definitions.abatement: Remove or cover a dangerous material, such as lead or mercury, from water, paint, or air, or other places.
definitions.ability: To able to or can do.
definitions.ablation: To remove or destroy a body part or tissue. This can be done in many ways, including surgery, radiation, or drugs.
definitions.abnormal: Something that is not usual, like a growth or low or high amounts of blood cells.
definitions.abolish: To end or get rid of.
definitions.abscess: Caused by an infection; a pocket of pus. You can get them anywhere in your body.
definitions.absenteeism: When you miss work or school.
definitions.absorb, absorption: To take in or soak up fluids.
definitions.abstain from, abstinance: To not do or not use.
definitions.accelerate: To hurry up or make worse.
definitions.access: To be able to get into something or place.
definitions.accessibility: To be easily able to get to something or to comply with federal laws and standards to help people with disabilities .
definitions.accessible: Something that is available or can be understood easily.
definitions.accommodate: To adjust to or adapt to something.
definitions.accompany: To take with or go along with.
definitions.accomplish: To do or carry out something.
definitions.accupressure: The use of pressure or massage at specific points on the body to control symptoms such as pain or nausea.
definitions.accupuncture: The use of thin needles through the skin at specific points on the body to control pain and other symptoms.
definitions.accupuncturist: A person trained to do accupuncture or accupressure.
definitions.accurate: Something that is true or right.
definitions.ACE inhibitors: This kind of drug is used to lower your blood pressure. They make your heart work less hard. It is used to treat heart disease and to keep heart failure from getting worse. If your blood pressure is lower that also helps lower your chance of stroke or heart attack. These drugs are also used to treat diabetes and kidney problems. There are many different names for these drugs, including lisinopril, benazepril, and quinapril. Also called angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors.
definitions.acellular vaccine: a vaccine that only contains part of the virus
definitions.acetaminophen: An over-the-counter (OTC) drug that relieves many types of pain. A brand name for this drug is Tylenol.
definitions.acid reflux: Occurs when your stomach contents come back up into your esophagus, causing heartburn, also called acid reflux. A longer lasting form is called gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
definitions.acne: A skin condition when the space where hairs grow get clogged up with oil and dead skin cells.
definitions.acquired immune deficiency syndrome: A disease caused by a virus (HIV or human immunodeficiency virus) that makes it hard for your body to fight diseases. Also called AIDS.
definitions.active immunity: Being able to fight off a disease once you have had that disease. Also called adaptive immunity.
definitions.acute: An illness or symptom that begins suddenly or lasts a short time. It can also be an intense flare-up of an illness.
definitions.acute lymphocytic leukemia: A fast-growing disease that occurs when there are too many of of a specific type of white blood cells (called lymphocytes or lymphoblasts). A fast-growing disease. Also called acute lymphoblastic leukemia or ALL. It is the most common type of cancer in children.
definitions.acute myeloid leukemia: A fast-growing disease that occurs when there are too many of a type of white blood cell (myeloblast) that crowds out other types of blood cells. It is the most common type of leukemia in adults. Also called AML.
definitions.adaptive immunity: Being able to fight off a disease once you have had that disease. Also called active immunity.
definitions.addict: A person who cannot stop using substances, such as medications or alcohol.
definitions.addictive: Something that, if you take it often, will be hard to stop taking.
definitions.adhere, adherence: To stick to or follow treatment.
definitions.adjuvant: Something that is added to a vaccine to make it work better.
definitions.administer: To give to (a person) or to take care of a project.
definitions.adrenal gland: Controls your sex drive and stress.
definitions.advantageous: Something that is helpful or useful.
definitions.adverse event, adverse effect: Harmful, such as a bad reaction to a medication.
definitions.adverse impact: Something bad that happens that you did not expect.
definitions.advocate, advocacy: To support, fight on behalf of someone or something.
definitions.aerobic: requies or needs oxygen to live
definitions.aerobic exercise: Slow and steady exercises, like walking, running, biking, swimming, that help your heart stay healthy and work better
definitions.aggravate: In illness, to make worse or harm. In emotions, anger or hurt.
definitions.aggressive: In diseases: fast growing or dangerous In emotions: pushy
definitions.airways: The tubes that take air in and out of your lungs.
definitions.alcoholic steatohepatitis: Occurs when fat builds up in your liver when you drink a lot of alcohol. this causes damage to your liver and it does not work as well as it should. Also called alcoholic fatty liver disease.
definitions.allergen: Something, like pollen, dust, mold, or animal dander, that causes a reaction in your body, such as a rash or sneezing.
definitions.allergic rhinitis: Caused by your body's reaction in your nose to mold, pollen, or dust. Also called hay fever.
definitions.allergic, allergic reaction, allergy: Your body's reaction (sneezing, rash, coughing) to something, like pollen or dust. Reactions can be serious or minor.
definitions.allergist: A doctor who treats people with reactions to things such as pollen, dust, or mold (allergies).
definitions.allogeneic bone marrow transplant: Healthy stem cells (blood-forming cells) are given to a patient to replace their own stem cells that have been destroyed by treatment. The new cells come from a person whose genes are similar to those of the patient. Also called a stem cell transplant.
definitions.allow: To let, to give permision for.
definitions.alopecia: Hair loss due to family history, disease, or medication.
definitions.alpha blockers: This kind of drug is used with other drugs to treat high blood pressure. It can also be used to treat prostate problems in men. There are many different names for these drugs, including nebivolol and tamsulosin.
definitions.alpha-agonist hypotensive agents: A type of drug to treat high blood pressure. They lower your heart rate and relax the blood flow. There are different names for these drugs, including clonidine and tizanidine.
definitions.alveoli: The tiny air sacs in the lungs.
definitions.amalgam, amalgam fillings: The silver-colored fillings, mixture of metals used to fill cavities in teeth.
definitions.amblyopia: When one of your eyes doesn't work properly with your brain. Also called lazy eye.
definitions.ambulatory: To able to walk or move around.
definitions.amnesia: When you are not able to remember new information.
definitions.amniocentesis: A way to check on a baby's health before it is born, using a small amount of fluid from around the baby.
definitions.amniotic fluid: The fluid surrounding unborn baby in a mother's womb.
definitions.amyotrophic lateral sclerosis: A disease that attacks the nerve cells in your brain and spinal cord that carry messages to your muscles. Also called ALS, Lou Gehrig's Disease, or motor neuron disease.
definitions.anaerobic: Something that does not need oxygen to live. The opposite of aerobic.
definitions.anaerobic exercise: Fast exercise, such as sprinting, or muscle-building exercise, like weight lifting.
definitions.analgesic: A pain reliever, over-the counter (such as aspirin or acetominopen) or prescription drugs.
definitions.anaphylaxis: A serious allergic reaction that happens quickly and can be fatal.
definitions.anemia: A low red-blood count. Your blood does not have enough of the cells that carry oxygen (hemaglobin) to your body. Also called "tired blood"or "low iron".
definitions.anesthesia: A drug that reduces pain (a local anesthetic) or that puts you to sleep (a general anesthetic), as during surgery.
definitions.aneurysm: A bulge in the wall of an artery. If it gets large, it can burst and cause serious bleeding.
definitions.angina: Chest pain or disconfort that you feel when there is not enough blood flowing to your heart. Stable angina is also called "angina pectoris".
definitions.annual, annually: Something that occurs once a year.
definitions.anomaly: Something that is different or unusual.
definitions.anorexia: An eating disorder, where you eat much less than your needs.
definitions.anti-inflammatory: A drug to reduce swelling and so reduce pain.
definitions.anti-viral: A drug that fights a virus, like those that cause the flu. Also called anti-virus.
definitions.antibody: Cells in your blood that fight infections or other abnormal substances.
definitions.anticoagulants: These types of drugs, also called blood thinners, help prevent blood clots from forming or getting bigger. Blood clots can cause blockages in arteries or veins, heart attacks or strokes. There are different names for these drugs, including warfarin and dabigatran.
definitions.antifungal agent: a drug that treats an infection caused by a fungus
definitions.antigen: An abnormal substance in your body that must be fought off by antibodies.
definitions.antiphospholipid syndrome: When you have high number of antibodies that are related to blood clots. Also known as APS.
definitions.antiphospholipid test: A blood test to see if you are at risk for blood clots.
definitions.antiplatelet drugs: These types of drugs, also called blood thinners, prevent blood cells (platelets) from forming a clot. Blood clots can cause blockages in arteries or veins, heart attacks or strokes. There are different names for these drugs, including prasugrul and clopidogrel.
definitions.aortic stenosis: When the valve for your aorta doesn't open enough and blocks the flow of blood to your heart.
definitions.aphasia, aphasic: When it is difficult for you to to talk, read, or write.
definitions.apparent: Something that is clear, or when somoen show up.
definitions.applicant: The name of the person who is filling out a form, such as for a job or for insurance.
definitions.apply: For medicine: To put or rub on. For a form or rule: To use the right form or follow the right rule.
definitions.appreciate: In medicine: to find. Also to thank or be grateful.
definitions.appropriate, appropriately: A good fit or the right way to use something.
definitions.ARBs: This kind of drug is used to lower your blood pressure. It is used to treat heart disease because it lets your heart work less hard. There are many different names for these drugs, including losartan, valsarten, and olmesartan. Also called angiotensin II receptor beta blockers.
definitions.arrhythmia: A problem with the rate of your heart or when your heart doesn’t have a steady beat.
definitions.arteriosclerosis, atherosclerosis: Happens when the walls of the arteries get narrow and hard. Also called hardening of the arteries.
definitions.artery: Vessels that carry blood from the heart to the body's organs.
definitions.arthritis: A disease of the joints that causes swelling, pain, heat, and stiffness.
definitions.ascertain: To find out or or make certain.
definitions.aspirate, aspiration: A way to take out fluid or tissue for a test or to breathe in food or other things into your lungs.
definitions.assay: Another name for a lab test.
definitions.assess, assessment: To review or evaluate, such as checking to see if a drug or exericse is helping or not. Also, a test to review.
definitions.associate with: To link two or more things together.
definitions.asthma: A long-term (or chronic) disease that affects the airways to your lungs. When they are swollen, you can not breathe easily.
definitions.astigmatism: When you can't see clearly close up or far away.
definitions.asymptomatic: A person who is sick, but does not feel or look sick. If lots of people are sick but don't feel sick, they can help spread a disease (also known as asymptomatic transmission).
definitions.atherosclerosis: A disease where your arteries get stiff and clogged by things in your blood, such as fat and calcium, called "plaque".
definitions.atopic dermatitis: A long- lasting itchy red rash, caused by a skin reaction.
definitions.attack: The sudden start of a disease.
definitions.attenuated vaccine: A type of vaccine that uses a weakened form of the virus.
definitions.aural: Related to your sense of hearing.
definitions.authentic: Something that is original or true.
definitions.authorize: To allow or give the power to someone.
definitions.autism specturm disorder: Affects how a person talks to and interacts with other people and how they learn. Also called autism, Asperger's syndrome or ASD.
definitions.autoimmune disease, autoimmunity: A disease that makes your body attack healthy cells by mistake.
definitions.autonomous: Someone who is independent, can act on their own.
definitions.avian flu: A disease that chickens and other birds get. People who work closely with birds can sometimes catch it too. Also called bird flu or HPAI.
definitions.bacteria: Very small living things, or “bugs,” that can be helpful (they help to digest food) or can cause illness (strep throat, for example).
definitions.behavior problems: When you act in an angry way or have trouble paying attention or sitting still.
definitions.beneficial: Something that is helpful or good.
definitions.benefit: Has a good effect or provides an advantage.
definitions.benign: Something that isn't harmful or is not cancer.
definitions.benign prostatic hyperplasia: A prostate gland that has gotten bigger. A normal part of aging in men. It is not cancer. Also called enlarged prostate gland.
definitions.bereavement: The grief you feel after a death, sadness, mourning.
definitions.beta blockers: This kind of drug slows how fast your heart is beating. It also lowers thow strongly your heart muscle contracts for a short time. When you use it for more time, a beta blocker helps to keep your heart failure from becoming worse. It may also help strengthen your heart. There are many different names for these drugs, including atenolol, metoprolol, and nebivolol.
definitions.beverage: Something that you drink, fluids, liquids.
definitions.biannual: Something that occurs two times a year.
definitions.biennial: Something that happens every other year, every two years.
definitions.biofilm: A sticky film with germs found on your teeth. Also called plaque.
definitions.biological agent: A living thing that can cause something to happen, such as a virus or bacteria.
definitions.biopsy: When a piece of tissue from a part of your body is taken for testing.
definitions.bioterrorism: To spread fear or harm using a virus or bacteria.
definitions.birth control: Designed to prevent pregnancy. Also called contraception. There are different methods, inlcuding pills, devices implanted in our body, or surgery for women or men (sterilization).
definitions.birth defects: A problem that happens while a baby is developing in the mother's body, often very early in pregnancy. Birth defects affect how the body looks and works. They include heart disease, cleft lip, and Fragile X Syndrome.
definitions.bladder: A hollow organ that stores pee (urine).
definitions.blood: A fluid in your body that carries things that are needed for your body to work well, such as vitamins, minerals, and oxygen to cells. It also takes waste products away.
definitions.blood clots: Blood clots occur naturally when you are cut to stop the bleeding. They disappear when your body heals. But sometimes, blood clots do not dissolve or there are too many of them, and they can travel to distant body parts, such as your brain or heart.
definitions.blood glucose: The main types of blood sugar in your body.
definitions.blood lead level: A test to find how much lead is in your body.
definitions.blood pressure: The force of your blood pressing against the walls of your arteries. The high number (systolic pressure) measures when your heart beats and the low number (diastolic pressure) measures between beats.
definitions.blood profile: A blood test that shows each type of blood cell. Also called a complete blood count or CBC.
definitions.blood sample: A small amount of blood taken from the finger or arm to be tested.
definitions.body mass index: A way to measure your body fat based on your height and weight. Also called BMI.
definitions.bones: The solid tissues that help you to move and support your body. They grow and change during your life.
definitions.bone density test: A test of how solid and how strong your bones are. A test for brittle bones (osteoporosis).
definitions.bone marrow: The tissue inside some of your larger bones where blood cells are made.
definitions.bone marrow aspiration: When a small sample of bone marrow is removed from a bone. The liquid is sent to a laboratory to be studied.
definitions.bone marrow biopsy: When a small sample of bone is removed and sent to a laboratory to be studied.
definitions.booster shot: A shot that you get months or years after your first vaccine shot, to help keep you safe from certain diseases.
definitions.bowel movement: The last step of food moving through your body. Also called poop, stool, or feces.
definitions.brachial neuritis: A swelling of the nerves in your arms.
definitions.breakthrough infection: Getting ill even though you've been protected against the disease.
definitions.breastfeeding: Feeding a baby with milk from the breast; nursing.
definitions.brain: The organ that controls your thoughts, memory, speech, and movements. It also controls the functions of many organs.
definitions.breech birth: A baby that is born feet or rear-end first.
definitions.bronchial tubes: The tubes that take air in and out of your lungs.
definitions.bronchodilator: A drug that helps you breathe easier.
definitions.bruxism: When you clench or grind your teeth.
definitions.burden: The results, effects, or costs of a plan or disease.
definitions.bursitis: Joint pain caused by swelling in a tiny sac between your bones and muscles, tendons, or skin.
definitions.calcium: A mineral that makes your bones and teeth strong.
definitions.calcium channel blockers: This kind of drug lowers your blood pressure. It can also be used to treat chest pain and a heart beat that is not regular. There are many different names for these drugs, including amlodipine, diltiazem, and nifedipine.
definitions.calculate: To add up or figure out.
definitions.calculus: A hard crusty coating on teeth or a "stone" in an organ (kidney or bladder stones, for example).
definitions.cancer: Occurs when new cells grow rapidly, even when they are not needed. These cells crowd out other cells. Cancer can occur anyplace in your body. There are many types of cancer, including those that begin in your blood (leukemia), in specific organs (kidney cancer) or tissues (soft tissue sarcoma).
definitions.canine teeth: Sharp teeth, right next to your incisors. Also called eye teeth or cuspids.
definitions.canker sores: Small, round sores in your mouth.
definitions.capable, capability: To be able to do something or capable of doing something.
definitions.capacity: The size of an object. Can also mean ability.
definitions.capillary: Tiny blood vessels that connect the small arteries and veins.
definitions.capillary sample: A small amount of blood that is taken from your finger to run a simple test. Also called a "finger stick."
definitions.carcinoma: A type of cancer that begins in your skin or the lining of an organ.
definitions.cardiologist: A doctor who treats heart and blood vessel problems.
definitions.cardiology: The study of heart and blood vessel problems, or the medical department that treats heart and blood vessel problems.
definitions.cardiovascular: Having to do with your heart and blood vessels.
definitions.caries: Holes in your teeth. Also called cavities or tooth decay.
definitions.carotid artery disease: When the arteries in your neck become narrow or blocked.
definitions.carpal tunnel syndrome: Injury to a nerve in your wrist that happens when you do the same motion over and over again.
definitions.carrier: A person who is sick and can get other people sick.
definitions.cartilage: The smooth covering on the end of your bones.
definitions.case fatality rate: The number that tells how many people die from a disease ina certain group of people, such as a city or state.
definitions.case management: Someone who helps people who are sick to get the help they need.
definitions.case report: Details of one patient’s illness, including symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up.
definitions.case-control study: A type of study that compares people who have an illness or other health condition (cases) to a group of people without that condition (controls).
definitions.CAT scan: A special type of imaging that creates three-dimensional X-rays. Also called CT scans or computed axial tomography.
definitions.cataracts: A clouding of the eye that makes it hard to see, often in older people.
definitions.catheter: A tube for putting fluids into or taking them out of your body.
definitions.catheterize: To put a tube into a part of your body.
definitions.causal association: Something that leads your body to react.
definitions.cauterize: To burn your skin to stop bleeding.
definitions.caveat: A warning or detail to think about.
definitions.celiac disease: A disease where you cannot eat foods with gluten, found in many grains, such as wheat. If youeat gluten it wll damage your small intestine.
definitions.cell culture: To take cells or tissues from your body and watch them grow.
definitions.cellulitis: An infection of your skin and the cells underneath.
definitions.cementum: A hard covering of the outside of the root of your tooth below the gum line.
definitions.Centers for Disease Control and Preventi: The agency that studies health, safety, and security. Also called the CDC.
definitions.central nervous system: Includes the brain and spinal cord. Also called CNS.
definitions.cerebral hemorrhage: A stroke, bleeding that occurs in your brain. Also called cerebral accident or cerebrovascular accident or CVA. An ischemic stroke, caused by a blood clot that blocks a blood vessel in the brain. A hemorrhagic stroke is caused by a blood vessel that breaks and bleeds into the brain.
definitions.cervix: The lower part of the womb, where the baby grows during pregnancy.
definitions.cesarean delivery: When a baby is born through surgery. Also called a C-section.
definitions.chelation: A treatment that removes lead from your body if your blood lead levels are very high.
definitions.chemotherapy: A drug that kills cancer cells.
definitions.chest film: An X-ray, or picture, of your chest.
definitions.chipping paint: Paint from your house that is coming off in pieces.
definitions.chlamydia: Caused by a germ (a bacteria) that is passed during oral or genital sex from one person to another.
definitions.cholesterol: A kind of fat in your blood. Some cholesterol is useful in your body. Too much can lead to diseases such as hardening of your arteries (atherosclerosis) or coronary artery disease.
definitions.chronic: Something, like a disease or symptom, that lasts for a long time.
definitions.chronic fatigue syndrome: A serious, long-term illness that affects many body systems. It is also called myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS).
definitions.chronic kidney disease: Damaged kidneys can't filter blood the way that they should. Wastes can build up in your body, in addition to other health problems.
definitions.chronic lymphocytic leukemia: Occurs when there are too many of of a type of white blood cell (lymphocytes) that crowd out other types of blood cells. Chronic leukemias grow slowly. Also called CLL.
definitions.chronic myeloid leukemia: Occurs when there are too many of a type of white blood cell (granulocytes) that crowd out other types of blood cells. Chronic leukemias grow slowly. Also called CML.
definitions.chronic obstructive pulmonary disease: Lung diseases, such as chronic bronchitis or emphysema. Also called COPD.
definitions.circadian rhythmn disorders: When you're unable to go to sleep or wake up at the right times.
definitions.circulation: The flow of blood through the body.
definitions.circumcision: The removal of the foreskin of the penis in surgery.
definitions.cirrhosis: Scarring of the liver because of injury or long-term disease. Scar tissue cannot perform the functions of liver tissue, so your liver function is not as good as it needs to be.
definitions.cleft lip and palate: Happens when your baby's mouth or lip do not form properly. There can be an opening in their lip or one in the roof of their mouth (also called the palate) or both.
definitions.clinical trial: Research studies that test new treatments on patients.
definitions.coagulate: When blood cells clot or clump together.
definitions.collaborate: To work together or help each other.
definitions.colonoscopy: Looks at the inside of the large intestine using a flexible tube with a ltiny camera at the end.
definitions.colorectal: Concerning the colon and the rectum. The large intestine.
definitions.coma: When a person is deeply unconcious because of illness or injury. A person in a coma cannot move or talk.
definitions.combination vaccine: A vaccine that helps stop more than one type of disease, such as the TDaP (tetanus, diphtheira, and pertussis).
definitions.combine, combination: To mix 2 or more things; or a mixture.
definitions.communicable: An illness that can be spread to other people. Also called "catching".
definitions.communicate: To talk or write to others or to let you know.
definitions.community immunity: When a group is protected from a disease. Also called herd immunity.
definitions.community transmission: When a disease spreads and there is no close link to another confirmed case of the disease.
definitions.comparable: Something, such as a drug, that is similar to another drug.
definitions.compensate, compensation: To pay or make up for something bad that has happened.
definitions.competent: Someone who is skillful or well trained.
definitions.complaint: Your illness or symptom that is most important; the main reason you go to the doctor. Also known as "chief complaint".
definitions.complimentary: Something that is free or given away.
definitions.comply, compliance: Following a medical plan or doctor’s instructions. Also, following the law.
definitions.component: A part or a section of a larger object.
definitions.composite, composite filling: A tooth-colored filling, not a silver-colored (or amalgam) filling.
definitions.comprehensive: Something that is complete or thorough.
definitions.compress: To squeeze or press down on.
definitions.compulsion: When you have a strong urge or desire to do something.
definitions.computed tomography: A special type of imaging that creates three-dimensional X-rays. Also called CT scans or CAT scans (computed axial tomography).
definitions.concentration: The amount of an ingredient in a drug or medicine.
definitions.conclusive: Something that is definite or final,
definitions.concur: To agree or feel the same way.
definitions.condition: A medical problem, like a disease or an illness.
definitions.conduct, conducting: To do something or to carry out a project.
definitions.congenital, congenital anomaly: Something that you are born with, such as a heart problem or cleft palate.
definitions.congestive heart failure: When your heart can't pump enough blood. Also called heart failure or CHF.
definitions.conjugate vaccine: A vaccine in 2 parts that makes it more effective.
definitions.conjunctivitis: An infection around your eyes. Also called pinkeye.
definitions.conspicuous: Something that is easy to see or obvious.
definitions.consume: To eat or drink or to use up.
definitions.contact: To talk, call, or get in touch with.
definitions.contagious: A disease that can be spread from one person to another. When someone is sick and might make you sick, too.
definitions.contaminate, contaminated: To infect someone or make some place dirty.
definitions.contingent upon: One thing will happen if another also does.
definitions.contract: To make something smaller or to catch a disease.
definitions.contraindicated, contraindication: Something that is not recommended or not allowed.
definitions.contrast medium: A dye that helps make tissues or organs more visible on an X-ray or CT scan.
definitions.control: To manage, or take care of.
definitions.controlled trial: A medical study that compares one treatment to another treatment.
definitions.convenient: Something that is easy to use or nearby.
definitions.convulsion: Movements that you can't control caused by unusual activity in your brain. Also called a fit or seizure.
definitions.COPD: A lung disease that makes breathing hard. Also known as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, emphysema, or chronic bronchitis.
definitions.coronary: Related to the blood vessels that bring blood to the heart.
definitions.coronary artery disease: When the blood vessels that bring blood and oxygen to the heart become narrow. Also called coronary heart disease or CAD.
definitions.coronary heart disease: When the blood vessels that bring blood and oxygen to the heart become narrow. Also called coronary atery disease or CAD.
definitions.coronavirus: A group of germs (viruses) that cause a variety of diseases, including severe acute respiratory syndorme (SARS) and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS).
definitions.coronavirus disease: A disease caused by a new germ (virus) that causes fever, cough and difficulty breathing. It was first noticed in late 2019 in Wuhan, China. Also called 2019 Novel Coronavirus or COVID-19
definitions.correlate, correlation: Two or more things that are linked or related to each other.
definitions.correspond: To similar to or be in agreement with.
definitions.corticosteroids: A type of drug that is used to treat a variety of diseases and conditions. They reduce swelling and help your immune system. Also called corticosteroids or glucocorticoids.
definitions.cough etiquette: How to cough or sneeze so that you do infect as many people.
definitions.COVID-19: A new disease caused by a new germ (a virus called SARS-CoV-2) that causes fever, cough and difficulty breathing. It was first noticed in late 2019 in Wuhan, China. Also called 2019 Novel Coronavirus or coronavirus disease. It seems to have begun in bats and then moved to humans who worked closely with wild animals.
definitions.cradle cap: A type of dandruff that babies get.
definitions.crib death: When a baby dies suddenly, without reason. Also called SIDS or Sudden Infant Death Syndrome.
definitions.Crohn's disease: A disease that lasts for a long time and causes isevere irritation in your digestive tract (bowels).
definitions.crossbite: When your upper teeth are biting inside the lower teeth, not with them,
definitions.croup: Swelling around your vocal cords that causes breathing difficulties.
definitions.crown: A covering on a tooth. Can be made from different materials, including porcelain or gold.
definitions.cushingoid: A full, round face, like a patient with high levels of the hormone cortisol.
definitions.cyst: Pus or other liquid under your skin.
definitions.cystitis: An infection in your bladder, often causes pain when you pee.
definitions.dabigatran: A type of blood thinner. It helps prevent clots from forming or getting bigger. Blood clots can cause blockages in arteries or veins, heart attacks or strokes.
definitions.dander: Small pieces of skin. Also called dandruff when there are a lot of flakes.
definitions.dandruff: Flaking and itchiness of your skin.
definitions.deaf: When you can't hear any sounds at all.
definitions.deciduous teeth: The first teeth that grow in young children. There are 20 primary teeth. They fall out and are replaced by permanent teeth. Also called milk teeth or baby teeth.
definitions.decontaminate: To clean an object or buidlding, or person to kill germs or other harmful things.
definitions.deep vein thrombosis: A blood clot that forms in a vein deep in your body.
definitions.deformity: Something that is not a normal shape or is oddly shaped.
definitions.dehydration: When you lose too much fluid or water from your body.
definitions.deleading: Work done to remove or cover lead paint. Also called abatement.
definitions.deltoid: The muscle in your upper arm.
definitions.dementia: Memory loss that gets worse over time. It also affects how well you can do everyday chores and focus. The most common kind is Alzheimer's disease.
definitions.dental caries: Holes in your teeth. Also called cavities or tooth decay.
definitions.dental implant: A fake tooth that is put into your jaw bone.
definitions.dental pulp: The soft tissue (dental pulp) in your teeth.
definitions.dental sealant: A thin layer painted onto teeth to prevent tooth decay.
definitions.dentin: The main bone-like part of a tooth.
definitions.dentist: A doctor who treats diseases in your teeth and gums.
definitions.dentistry: The study of teeth and gums.
definitions.dentures: Fake teeth made to replace your own teeth. They can replace all of your teeth or just a few. Also called false teeth.
definitions.deplete: To empty or take all of something.
definitions.depression: When feelings of sadness and hopeless last for a long time.
definitions.dermatitis: When your skin swells and is itchy. Also called eczema.
definitions.dermatologist: A doctor who treats diseases of the skin.
definitions.DES: A drug that was used many years ago to help pregnant women. There can be some health risks to the mother and the baby.
definitions.describing: To tell what something or someone is like.
definitions.deteriorate: To get worse ot fall apart.
definitions.detrimental: Something that is harmful or bad.
definitions.developmental assessment: To check how well your child talks, hears, learns, and moves.
definitions.developmental disability: Problems that last a long time and have an effect on daily life, like Down Syndrome or learning differences.
definitions.diabetes: A disease where you have too much sugar (or glucose) in your blood. Also called diabetes mellitus. Type 1 diabetes happens most often in kids or young adults. Type 2 usually happens when you are older. Type 1 diabetes is also called juvenile diabetes or insulin-dependent diabetes.
definitions.diabetes insipidus: A disease where your kidneys don't work well and you need to pee a lot.
definitions.diagnose, diagnosis: To find out the problem, condition, or disease.
definitions.diagnostic procedure: A test to look for a specific problem.
definitions.dialysis: A treatment that does the work of your kidneys when they can't. Also called hemodialysis.
definitions.diaphoresis: Sweating, a clear, salty liquid produced by glands in your skin. Sweating is how your body cools itself. Also called persperation.
definitions.diarrhea: Loose, watery stools three or more times a day. It can be sudden (due to a virus, for example), persistent, or chronic, that is, lasting a long time.
definitions.dietary supplements: Vitamins, minerals, herbs, and many other products.
definitions.diffuse: Something that is widespread or scattered.
definitions.digestive diseases: Any of the diseases that occur in your stomach or intestinal tract.
definitions.dilator: A tool that is used to make something become larger or wider.
definitions.dilute: To weaken or make less strong.
definitions.dimension: The whole size of an object or just one part.
definitions.diminish, diminished: To make smaller or less intense.
definitions.diminutive: Something that is very small or tiny.
definitions.diplopia: Happens when your eyes do not work together, so you see 2 images of the same thing. Also called double vision.
definitions.directed to: To be told to do something.
definitions.discharge: Going home or leaving the hospital.
definitions.discoid lupus: A disease where your body's immune system attacks healthy cells by mistake. Discoid lupus causes a red rash that doesn't go away.
definitions.discover: To find out or learn if something will happen.
definitions.discrimination: Not being treated fairly, usually because of your race, sex, age, or income.
definitions.discuss: To talk about or talk with.
definitions.disease registry: A way to keep track of information about specific patients and illnesses.
definitions.dislocation: When your joint is injured and the bones are pushed out of position.
definitions.disproportionate: Something that affects some people or groups more than others.
definitions.distal: The back of or an end that is farther away.
definitions.distribute: To hand out items to a group or to see how many objects or cases of a disease occur in a certain area.
definitions.diuretics: A group of drug that helps your body get rid of too much fluid. They are also known as "water pills". There are many kinds and names of these drugs, including furosemide, hydrochlorothiazide, and triamterene/ HCTZ.
definitions.diverticulitis: Occurs when one or a few of the pouches in the wall of your colon become inflamed.
definitions.diverticulosis: Occurs when small pouches form and push outward through weak spots in the wall of your colon.
definitions.dizziness: When you feel lightheaded, woozy, or confused.
definitions.DNA: The part of your genes that influences the way you look and grow.
definitions.dose: The amount or size of a substance, such as a drug or radiation.
definitions.double blind study: A study where the researchers and the patients don’t know who gets what drug.
definitions.Down syndrome: Occurs when a baby is born with an exrea copy of a gene. Can cause physical aproblems as well as delays in
definitions.drug-induced lupus: A disease where your body's immune system attacks healthy cells by mistake. Drug-induced lupus is caused by certain drugs and usually goes away when you stop taking the drug.
definitions.dry mouth: When your mouth feels dry for a long time. Also called xerostomia.
definitions.dysarthria: When you have difficulty speaking because your muscles don't work well. Also called slurred speech.
definitions.dysmenorrhea: When you have pain and cramps during your period.
definitions.dyspepsia: When you are uncomfortable or feel burning around your stomach.
definitions.dysphagia: When you have trouble or pain when you swallow.
definitions.dystonia: When some of your muscles spasm over and over again.
definitions.dysuria: When it is difficult or painful to pee.
definitions.early childhood caries: When the teeth of young children get holes in them. Aslo called ECC.
definitions.Ebola: A very serious illness that causes fever and bleeding. Also called Ebola hemorrhagic fever or Ebola virus disease.
definitions.echocardiography, echocardiogram: A test that uses sound waves to create pictures of your heart. It show more than an X-ray. Also called an ECK or EKG.
definitions.economical: Something that is cheap or priced low.
definitions.ectopic pregnancy: When the fertilized egg does not grow in the womb.
definitions.eczema: When your skin swells and is itchy. Also called dermatitis.
definitions.edema: Swelling caused by too much fluid in your body.
definitions.edentulous: When you have few or no teeth.
definitions.effect, effectiveness: The result or success of a drug or surgery.
definitions.efficacy: How well something, such as a drug or operation, works.
definitions.EKG: A test of your heart's health. It shows how fast your heart is beating and if its rhythmn is normal. Also called an electrocardiogram or ECG.
definitions.electrolytes: A group of minerals (mainly salt) in your blood.
definitions.electronic health record: Information about your health from visits to your doctors, medical tests, and surgeries that is stored on the internet. Also called an EHR, electronic medical record, or EMR.
definitions.electronic medical record: Information about your health from visits to your doctors, medical tests, and surgeries that is stored on the internet. Also called an EMR, electronic health record, or EHR.
definitions.elevated blood lead level: When your blood test for lead is 10 or higher. Also called EBLL.
definitions.eliminate: To get rid of or remove,. Also to go to the bathroom.
definitions.emaciated: Someone who is very thin or starving.
definitions.embolism, embolus: Something, often a blood clot, that blocks a blood vessel.
definitions.embryo: An unborn baby, age 5 weeks to 10 weeks.
definitions.emergency: An event or disease that is very serious and needs quick action.
definitions.emphysema: A lung disease that makes it hard to breathe. It gets worse over time. It is a type of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or COPD.
definitions.empirical evidence: Facts or proof, as from an experiment.
definitions.enamel: The hard covering on the outside of each tooth.
definitions.encephalitis: A disease that caused by a germ (a virus or bacteria) that makes your brain swell.
definitions.encephalopathy: Whenyour brain does not work well.
definitions.end stage renal disease: When your kidneys stop working. Also called chronic kidney disease, kidney failure, or end stage kidney disease.
definitions.endocarditis: An inflammation of the inner lining of the heart, most often caused by bacterial infections.
definitions.endocrine: The glands that produce hormones that flow through your blood to other parts of your body.
definitions.endocrinologist: A doctor who treast disease of the 8 glands that make up the endocrine system.
definitions.endocrinology: A person who conducts research on the 8 glands of the endocrine system.
definitions.endodontic: The treatment of diseases in the soft tissue (dental pulp) in your teeth.
definitions.endodontics: The study and treatment of disease in the soft tissues (dental pulp) inside your teeth.
definitions.endodontist: A dentist who treats diseases in the soft tissue (dental pulp) in your teeth.
definitions.endometriosis: Occurs when tissue like the lining of the uterus grows in other places in your body.
definitions.endoscopy: A way to look inside your body, using a small instrument (called a scope) with a camera on one end.
definitions.enlarged prostate gland: A prostate gland that has gotten bigger. A normal part of aging in men. It is not cancer. Also called benign prostatic hyperplasia.
definitions.enuresis: When your child hase problems controlling their urine. Also called bedwetting.
definitions.environment: Your home and all the things around you in your daily life, including the world around you.
definitions.environmental control: When harmful things (like lead or gas) are taken away from your home and work.
definitions.epidemic: Widespread sickness within a population (small children, for example) or area (state or country).
definitions.epidemiologist: A person who studies the way diseases spread.
definitions.epidemiology: The study of how disease spreads.
definitions.epidermis: The outer layer of your skin.
definitions.epilepsy: A brain disorder that causes seizures (jerking of muscles) or loss of conciousness (to appear to be asleep).
definitions.episode: An event or a set amount of time.
definitions.epizootic: A disease that is common in animals.
definitions.equilibrium: When things are in balance or a calm state of mind..
definitions.equivalent: Something that is equal to or the same as something else.
definitions.erosions: When something is gradually worn away, such as small holes in teeth. bones, or other surfaces.
definitions.eruption: Spots or a rash on your skin.
definitions.erythematosus: A red rash, often on your face.
definitions.erythrocyte sedimentation rate: A blood test that looks for signs of swelling (inlammation) in your body. Also called ESR.
definitions.esophagus: The tube that carries food and liquids from your mouth to your stomach.
definitions.ESR: A blood test that looks for signs of swelling (inlammation) in your body. Also called erythrocyte sedimentation rate.
definitions.essential hypertension: Occurs when the low pressure (diastolic) is 90 or higher or the high pressure (systolic) is 140 or higher. The most common kind of high blood pressure, it often develops as you age. Also called primary hypertension.
definitions.establish: To set up. Can also mean to show or prove.
definitions.evidence-based: A decision or treatment that uses facts, what the doctor knows, and what the patient knows.
definitions.evident: Something that is plain to see.
definitions.excise: To cut out or cut off.
definitions.expectorate: To cough or spit out mucous from your throat.
definitions.expedite, expeditious: To speed up or make something go faster.
definitions.expend: To spend something, like energy or money.
definitions.expire, expiration: The end date of a loan or when something, like a prescription, runs out.
definitions.expose, exposure: To come into contact with a substance. This can happen by touching, eating, or breathing it.
definitions.expressive language: To speak using words or sentences to talk with others.
definitions.extensive: A lot (of), wide-spread, throughout the body
definitions.ezetimibe: A drug that is used along with changes in diet, weight loss, and exercise to reduce the amounts of certain fats (cholesterol) in the blood. It can help reduce the chance of developing heart disease, heart attacks, or strokes.
definitions.faint, fainting: When you "black out "(or lose consciousness) for a short period of time. Also called syncope.
definitions.false teeth: Teeth made to replace your own teeth. They can replace all of your teeth or just a few. Also called dentures.
definitions.family history: health information about your close relatives
definitions.farsightedness: When you can see clearly far away, but not close up. Also called hyperopia.
definitions.fast: go without any food or drink, not eat or drink anything
definitions.fasting plasma glucose test: A blood test to screen for diabetes.
definitions.fatality rate: The number of people who die from a disease as a percent of the total number of people who got sick. If 5 people die for 100 who get sick, the fatality rate is 5 percent.
definitions.fatigue: tired, weak feeling of the whole body, feeling tired all over
definitions.fatty liver disease: Occurs when fat builds up in your liver. There are two main types: nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and alcoholic fatty liver disease (or alcoholic steatohepatitis).
definitions.feasible: Something that can be done or is possible.
definitions.febrile: To have a fever or appear to have a fever.
definitions.femur: Your thigh bone that connects your hip and knee.
definitions.fertility: The ability to have a baby.
definitions.fetal alcohol spectrum disorders: A combination of issues, including medical, behavioral, educational, and social problems, that occur when the mother drinks alcohol during pregnancy. Fetal Alcohol Syndrome (FAS) is the most serious type.
definitions.fetus: An unborn baby, from 12 weeks of age to birth.
definitions.fever: A body temperature that is higher than normal. Also called pyrexia.
definitions.fever blister: A sore in or around your mouth. It is caused by a germ (the herpes simlex virus). It can be spread to other people (it is infectious). Also called a cold sore.
definitions.fibrates: A type of drug that helps lower high levels of a type of fat in your blood (called triglycerides). They may also help increase the level of good cholesterol (HDL or high-density lipoprotein) in your blood. This helps protect you from heart disease, heart attacks, and stroke. There are several names for these drugs, including fenofibrate and gemfibrozil.
definitions.fibroids: Common growths in the womb that are not cancerous in women in their childbearing years. Also called uterine fibroids.
definitions.fibromyalgia: A chronic condition that causes pain all over your body, fatigue, and other symptoms.
definitions.fistula: A connection that is not normal between 2 organs or blood vessels. You can be born with a fistula or it can develop after surgery or a disease.
definitions.flare: When symptoms of a disease are worse.
definitions.floater: Little cobwebs or spots that float in your vision.
definitions.fluctuate: To rise and fall or change.
definitions.folk medicine: Plants or things found in nature used to cure illness. Folk medicine often comes from other countries or cultures. It does not come from a medical doctor. It is sometimes called traditional medicine or a home remedy.
definitions.food allergy: When your body responds to food in a way that is not normal. These reactions include swelling or itching in your mouth, throwing up, an itchy rash on your skin, or trouble breathing.
definitions.food poisoning: When you get sick because the food you ate had germs on it. Also called foodborne illness.
definitions.foodborne illness: When you get sick because the food you ate had germs on it. Also called food poisoning.
definitions.foot, feet: The part of your leg that you walk on.
definitions.fracture, fractured: A break, usually in a bone.
definitions.fragile X syndrome: An inherited developmental disability, that can make harder to learn; cause social or emotional issues, such as anger; or problems with talking.
definitions.friction: Rubbing two things or parts together.
definitions.frostbite: When your body is injured because of severe cold, most often on hands, feet, ears, and nose.
definitions.fructose: A kind of sugar in fruit and honey.
definitions.fungal infections: Caused by a type of germ (a fungus) that floats in the air. Most start in your lungs on on your skin. Some examples are yeast infections and athlete's foot.
definitions.furnish: To give something that is needed.
definitions.gallbladder: An organ located near your liver that stores a fluid (bile) that helps to digest fat.
definitions.gallstones: Formed when the fluid that helps to digest fat hardens. When the stones block the flow of bile, it can be very painful.
definitions.gamete: The egg (from women) or sperm (from men) that together can form the beginning of human life.
definitions.ganglion cyst: Growths that are not cancer that most oftengrow in your wrists or hands.
definitions.gangrene: When tissues in your body die. This happens when a part of your body loses its supply of blood.
definitions.gastritis: The name for a group of diseases that cause the lining of your stomach to be irritated.
definitions.gastroenteritis: When the lining of your intestines is swollen and irritated. It is caused by different kinds of germs (a virus, bacteria, or parasites). Also called "stomach flu," but it is not really the flu.
definitions.gastroenterologist: A doctor who treats problems with your stomach and related organs.
definitions.gastroenterology: The study of diseases of the stomach and intestines.
definitions.gastroesophageal reflux: When your stomach contents come back up into your esophagus, causing heartburn, also called acid reflux. Also called GERD.
definitions.gastroparesis: When the stomach muscle is paralyzed. Also called paralyzed stomach.
definitions.general anesthesia: To put to "sleep" before surgery or anotehr medical procedure.
definitions.generalize, generalized: Something that is widespread or braod.
definitions.genes: The cells that carry the traits that you get (inherit) from your parents.
definitions.genetic testing: Tests on blood and other tissues to find illnesses that run in families.
definitions.genetics: The study of family traits and how they are passed on through generations.
definitions.genital area: Your "private parts," or the sex organs outside your body.
definitions.genital herpes: Caused by a germ, the herpes simplex virus.
definitions.genital herpes simplex: Herpes (sores) around your privat parts (genital area) or rear end.
definitions.German measles: An infection caused by a germ (a virus) that usually has a mild fever and rash. Also called rubella or three-day measles.
definitions.gerontological: Something that is related to aging.
definitions.gestation: Pregnancy or the development of something over time.
definitions.GI specialist: A doctor who treats problems with your stomach and related organs. Also called a gastroenterologist.
definitions.giant cell arteritis: When the arteries in your head, neck and arms are swollen, so that the blood does not flow well. Also called temporal arteritis.
definitions.giardiasis: A disease caused by a bug (the parasite Giardia intestinalis) that lives in the ground, food, and water.
definitions.gingiva: The part of your gum s around the bottom of your teeth.
definitions.gingivectomy: Surgery on your gums to remove or reshape them.
definitions.gingivitis: A disease that makes your gums swollen and red.
definitions.glaucoma: A group of eye diseases that causes damage to the eye nerve and can lead to blindness.
definitions.global, globally: Around the world, i speaking of something broadly.
definitions.gonorrhea: A disease caused by a germ (a bacteria) that you get through sex.
definitions.gradually: Something that happens slowly or over time.
definitions.Guillain-Barre syndrome: A disease that affects your nerves and so makes it hard to move.
definitions.gynecologist: A doctor who helps women stay healthy treats diseases of the womb and related organs.
definitions.gynecology: The study of the functions and diseases that are specific to women and girls.
definitions.H1N1 flu: The swine flu. People usually do not get swine flu, but sometimes they do.
definitions.H5N1 flu: A disease that chickens and other birds get. People who work closely with birds can sometimes catch it too. Also called avian flue or bird flu.
definitions.Haemophilus influenzae type b: A germ (or virus) that causes several diseases, like bronchitis or infections in your blood. Also called Hib.
definitions.hallucinate, hallucinations: When you sense things, like such as visions, sounds, or smells, that seem real but are not.
definitions.hand hygiene: When and how to wash your hands.
definitions.Hansen's disease: A long-term disease caused by a germ (a bacteria) that affects the nerves around the outside of the body, skin, and eyes. Also called leprosy.
definitions.hazardous waste: Trash that comes from medical clinics, like used needles, bloody tissues, and so on.
definitions.HDL: A "good" kind of fat in your blood. Also called high-density lipoprotein.
definitions.health care provider: A person, like a doctor, nurse, or dentist who take care of you.
definitions.health care setting: Any place that you rget medical treatment, like a doctor ’s office, hospital, clinic, or laboratory.
definitions.health disparities: Differences in health among groups of people.
definitions.hearing impairment: When you have trouble hearing sounds or can't hear any sounds at all. Also called presbycusis or hearing disorders.
definitions.heart: An organ made of muscles that pumps blood through your body. It is on the left side of your body.
definitions.heart attack: Happens when blood flow to the heart is suddenly blocked by a blood clot or severe spasm of the coronary artery. Also called myocardial infarction.
definitions.heart diseases: Includes many types of diseases that affect your heart, such as the narrowing of the coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart, valve diseases, and heart failure. Sometimes called coronary heart disease.
definitions.heart failure: When your heart can't pump enough blood. Also called congestive heart failure or CHF.
definitions.heart valve: There are 4 valves in your heart that open to let blood flow through or out of your heart and then close to keep it from flowing backward. Common heart valve problems are regurgitation, mitral valve prolapse, and stenosis
definitions.hematocrit: A blood test that measures the amount of red blood cells in your blood
definitions.hematological: Related to blood or blood forming organs, like bone marrow.
definitions.hematoma: A bruise or when your skin is black and blue after an injury.
definitions.hematuria: When there is blood in your urine.
definitions.hemodialysis: A treatment that does the work of your kidneys when they can't. Also called dialysis.
definitions.hemoglobin A1C: A blood test to look at your blood sugar levels now or over time.
definitions.HEPA filter: A special filter for machines or appliances that can remove lead and other very small specks of dust from the air. Also called a high-efficiency particulate air filter.
definitions.hepatitis: An inflammation of the liver due to viruses or drug or alcohol use. The different types of hepatitis, A, B, C, D, and E. Drug or alcohol use can also cause hepatitis. In other cases, your body attacks healthy cells in the liver by mistake
definitions.hepatitis A: A disease that affects your liver. You get from drinking bad water or eating bad food.
definitions.hepatitis B: A disease that affects your liver. You get it from contact with someone else's blood or body fluids.
definitions.hepatitis C: Caused by a germ (a virus) that affects your liver. It can be a short-term disease or it can last for a long time.
definitions.hepatitis D: Caused by a germ (a virus) that affects your liver. It is only found in people who also have hepatitis B.
definitions.hepatitis E: Caused by a germ (a virus) that affects your liver. IYou get it by drinking contaminated water.
definitions.herd immunity: When a group is protected from disease, because most people have been vaccinated.
definitions.heritable, hereditary: genetic, traits that are passed down in families
definitions.herpes simplex: The germ (a virus) that causes cold sores.
definitions.herpes simplex type 1: The germ (a virus) that causes cold sores.
definitions.herpes zoster: A disease that causes painful sores on your skin. It is caused by the same bug (or virus) that causes chickenpox. Also called shingles.
definitions.high blood pressure: When your low pressure (diastolic) is 90 or higher or the high pressure (systolic) is 140 or higher. Also called hypertension.
definitions.high risk: When there is a good chance that something bad will happen.
definitions.high-density lipoprotein: A "good" kind of fat in your blood. Also called HDL.
definitions.hirsutism: In women, when more hair grows on your body.
definitions.Hodgkin lymphoma: A type of cancer that grows in a part of your immune system (your lymph nodes). Also called Hodgkin's disease.
definitions.home remedy: Plants or things found in nature used to cure illness. Folk medicine often comes from other countries or cultures. It does not come from a medical doctor. It is sometimes called traditional medicine or a home remedy.
definitions.homologous: Things that are similar or alike.
definitions.hormone: A group of chemicals that affect how your body works. They can be made by certain organs in your body or can be made in a factory so that you can take them if your body dosn't make enough.
definitions.host: A person, animal, or plant that another living thing lives off of.
definitions.HPAI: An illness in birds. People who work closely with birds can also get bird flu. Also called avian flu.
definitions.HPV: A group of germs (viruses) that may cause rough spots on your skin (warts) and increase your chances of getting some cancers. There is now a vaccine to prevent HPV. Also called human papillomaviruses.
definitions.hyperlipidemia: High levels of fat or fat-like substances (cholesterol). Hyperlipidemia is also called high cholesterol.
definitions.hyperopia: When you can see clearly far away, but not close up. Also called farsightedness.
definitions.hyperplasia: An increase in the rate of growth of cells in tissue or an organ, whicih leads to an increase in size of the organ. Can be not cancerous or an early sign of cancer.
definitions.hypersensitivity: When your body has more of a reaction to 1) things that you see, hear, touch, or smell or 2) drugs, pollen from plants, food, or insect stings
definitions.hypersomnia: When you can't stay awake during the day. Narcolepsy, which makes you very sleepy during the day, is one kind.
definitions.hypertension: When your low pressure (diastolic) is 90 or higher or the high pressure (systolic) is 140 or higher. Also called high blood pressure.
definitions.hypertensive heart disease: Heart problems that come from having high blood pressure over a long time.
definitions.hyperthyroidism: When your thyroid makes too much thyroid hormone.
definitions.hyposensitivity: When your body has less of a reaction to things that you see, hear, touch, or smell.
definitions.hypotension: When your blood pressure is low. For some people, this is normal, but it may cause problems for other people.
definitions.hypothalamus: Controls some basic functions of your body, such as how hot or cold you feel, if you are hungry, and how happy or sad you feel.
definitions.hypothesis: In research, an idea that is being tested.
definitions.hypoxia: When there is not enough oxygen in your blood.
definitions.hysterectomy: Surgery to remove ta woman's womb (or uterus).
definitions.identified, identify: To find out, determine who or what something is.
definitions.idiopathic: A disease or condition, with a cause that is not known.
definitions.immune: To be protected from a disease.
definitions.immune globulin: Part of your blood that helps to fight disease.
definitions.immune system: The body’s natural defense against sickness.
definitions.immunity: The ability to fight off an illness.
definitions.immunize, immunization: To protect again diseases, often by a shot.
definitions.immunosuppression: When your body can't fight diseases.
definitions.immunotherapy: Treatment to make the immune system work better.
definitions.impaction: A tooth that does not come up or when teeth grow in a tight space.
definitions.impaired: Driving when you have used alcohol or drugs. Also known as drunk driving. Can also mean that you are weakened because of health problems
definitions.impede: To get in the way or to slow down.
definitions.imperceptible: Something that is hard to see or hidden.
definitions.implant: To put something, such as a tooth or electrodes, into your body.
definitions.impotence, impotent: When a man either can’t get or can’t keep an erection.
definitions.in vitro: A test or procedure that happens in a laboratory.
definitions.in vivo: A test or procedure that happens inside a living body (animal or human).
definitions.inaccuracy: A mistake or the chance that there has been a mistake.
definitions.inactivated vaccine: A vaccine that uses the killed version of the germ that causes a disease, like the flu shot or the polio shot.
definitions.inapparent infection: When you are sick, but you don't feel sick.
definitions.incapacitate: To make it hard or impossible to do something.
definitions.incidence: How many new cases of a disease there are.
definitions.incubation period: The time between when a person is infected and and the first signs of sickness .
definitions.indigenous: Something that comes from a local area.
definitions.inexpensive: Things that are cheap or low priced.
definitions.infect: A disease spread by germs or to spread a disease
definitions.Infection: When germs get in your body and you get sick.
definitions.infectious: A disease that can spread from person to person.
definitions.infectious agent: Something that makes you sick, like a virus or bacteria.
definitions.infertile: When you are not able to get pregnant. Also called being sterile.
definitions.infertile, infertility: Not being able to become pregnant after a year of trying. Also called sterility.
definitions.inflame: To make hot, red, or swollen.
definitions.inflammatory bowel disease: A group of chronic illnesses where your intestines are very painful and swollen. The two most common kinds are ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease.
definitions.influenza: The flu. An infection by a virus that affects your mouth, nose, and throat.
definitions.informed consent: A process to help you decide to get a certain treatment or be in a research study after learning about the good and bad effects.
definitions.infusion: To put fluids or drugs directly into your blood.
definitions.inhaler: A device that helps to deliver drugs into your breathing tubes.
definitions.inherent: Something that is natural or a permanent part of someone.
definitions.inherit, inheritance: To acquire traits from a parent.
definitions.inhibit: To check, stop, or slow down.
definitions.inhibitor: A drug that slows down or stops a process.
definitions.inject, injection: A shot; to give medicine using a needle.
definitions.innovate, innovation: A new idea or the process of creating new ideas or things.
definitions.insomnia: When you are unable ot fall asleep or stay asleep.
definitions.insufficient: When something is not enough or too little.
definitions.insulin: Something made by agland that helps with digestion (your pancreas) that helps blood sugar (glucose) get into the cells of your body.
definitions.integrate: To combine or mix 2 or more things.
definitions.interior: Inside your body or a building.
definitions.intermittent: Something that happpens off and on
definitions.internal medicine: The study of the diseases of adults and of good health habits to prevent disease.
definitions.internal organs: Organs that are inside your body, like your heart, lungs, or stomach.
definitions.internist: A doctor who treats many diseases in adult patients and who also teaches patients good habits to help prevent disease.
definitions.interrupt: To stop, often for a short time.
definitions.intestines: Your intestines are tubes where food continues to be broken down. There are 2 parts. Your small intestine connects your stomach and your large intestine. Your large intestine is where stool is made and stored. The large intestine is also called the colon.
definitions.intramuscular: To put into a muscle. Some shots are given intramuscularly.
definitions.intrauterine device: A type of birth control that is placed inside the womb (uterus). Also called an IUD.
definitions.intravenous: To put a substance in a vein.
definitions.intubate: When a tube is put down your throat into your airways so you can breathe.
definitions.invasive disease: A disease that can spread to other parts of the body.
definitions.invasive procedure: To go into the body through a cut, slit, or puncture.
definitions.investigational vaccine: A vaccine is still being tested.
definitions.investigator: A person working on a research study.
definitions.iron: A mineral that can helps your body work in many ways. For example, it help blood carry oxygen and muscles to use oxygen.
definitions.irrefutable: Something that is certain or proved.
definitions.irritable: When you feel sensitive or grouchy.
definitions.irritable bowel syndrome: A group of symptoms, like repeated pain in your abdomen and changes in your bowel movements, diarrhea, constipation, or both. Also called IBS.
definitions.irritant: Something that is a bother or a pain.
definitions.isolate, isolation: To keep sick people at home or in the hospital so that their disease does not spread to other people.
definitions.jaundice: When the whites of your eyes and the skin look yellow. Happens when your liver cannot work as well as normal.
definitions.jet lag: When you have trouble sleeping after traveling quickly over long distances. It is temporary.
definitions.jock itch: A red, itchy rash that appears in warm, damp areas, like your inner thighs. It is caused by a germ (a fungus). Also called tinea cruris.
definitions.joint: Where 2 or more bones come together,like your shoulder or ankle.
definitions.juvenile disease or condition: A disease or condition that occurs in children.
definitions.Kaposi sarcoma: A kind of cancer that makes red or purple patches grow on your skin.
definitions.Kawasaki disease: An uncommon disease of children that causes blood vessels to swell.
definitions.kidney diseases: Most kidney diseases attack the the very small structures that filter waste (called nephrons). Also known as renal diseases.
definitions.kidney failure: When your kidneys stop working. Also called chronic kidney disease or end stage kidney disease.
definitions.kidney stones: A solid piece of material that forms in the kidney from material in the urine. They can be tiny or large. While most kidney stones pass without help sometimes a stone will get stuck, blocking urine and causing great pain.
definitions.kidney: You have 2 kidneys that filter your blood, removing wastes and the extra water that becomes surine.
definitions.labor: The process of a baby being born, from early pain to deliveery of the baaby.
definitions.laboratory tests: Medical tests that check a sample of your blood, urine, or body tissues to see if they are normal or not.
definitions.lactation: Using the milk from a mother's breast to feed a baby.
definitions.lactose intolerance: Means that you cannot digest food with lactose, a type of sugar found in milk and milk products.
definitions.landlord: Someone who owns a house or apartment and rents it to other people.
definitions.laryngitis: Swelling and irritation of your voice box. It is often caused by a germ (a virus). Also called hoarseness.
definitions.laser eye surgery: Surgery on the clear lens of your eye that reshapes it so that you may no longer need glasses. Also called LASIK.
definitions.lateral: The side or on the side.
definitions.latex allergy: Latex is a fluid that comes from a tree. It is used to make things like gloves, balloons, and condoms. Some people get a rash or other symptoms if they touch something made from latex.
definitions.lazy eye: When one of your eyes doesn't work properly with your brain. Also called amblyopia.
definitions.LDL: A "bad" kind of fat in your blood that can lead to disease. Also called low-density lipoprotein.
definitions.lead: A kind of metal that is sometimes found in paint or plumbing, epsecially in older buildings, and in folk medicine. It may also be found in work places, like auto repair or construction.
definitions.lead dust: Tiny bits of lead that are too small to see. It comes from old paint as it peels and cracks, it makes lead dust.
definitions.lead paint: Paint that has lead in it. Companies are no longer allowed to put lead in paint.
definitions.lead poisoning: A sickness caused by swallowing or breathing lead. When lead gets into children's bodies, it can hurt their brains and slow hpw they grow and develop.
definitions.learning disabilities, learning disabili: When you have trouble understanding what is said to you, what you read, or paying attention in school.
definitions.legionnaire's disease: A kind of pneumonia caused by a germ (a bacteria). You usually get it by breathing in mist from water that contains the bacteria. You do not catch it from other people.
definitions.leprosy: A long-term disease caused by a germ (a bacteria) that affects the nerves around the outside of the body, skin, and eyes. Also called Hansen's disease.
definitions.lesion: A sore or any part of your sking that looks different from the rest.
definitions.lethargic: When you feel slow or very sleepy.
definitions.leukemia: A cancer of the blood. Caused when white blood cells grow quickly and crowd out other types of blood cells. There are different types, including acute lymphocytic leukemia acute myeloid leukemia, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, and chronic myeloid leukemia.
definitions.leukodystrophies: A group or rare diseases that affect your brain, including Canavan disease, Alexander disease, or metachromatic leukodystrophy.
definitions.level of concern: When test results are high enough that there may be a serious health problem.
definitions.Lewy body dementia: A common type of dementia that affects the way you talk, your memory, and how you do everyday tasks.
definitions.life support: Treatments that can help your body when it has a serious disease or has been in an accident. It can include machines to help you breathe (ventilator) or to clean your blood (dialysis).
definitions.ligament: The tissue that connects a bone to another bone.
definitions.lipid profile: A blood test that measure the amount of different fats. Also called a lipid panel.
definitions.listeria: A disease that you get from food that has a germ (a bacteria) in it. the food can be cooked or not cooked.
definitions.live-attenuated vaccine: A vaccine that uses a weak form of the germ that causes the disease that won't cause the disease. Also called a live vaccine.
definitions.Liver spots: Flat brown or black spots that appear in your skin that is exposed to the sun. They are not related to your liver. They are common as you age.
definitions.liver: The largest organ inside your body. It helps to digest food, store energy, and remove poisons from your body.
definitions.local anesthesia: A drug that causes only in the area of the body where the drug is put, as when a tooth is pulled.
definitions.locality: A place, like a city,county or state.
definitions.lockjaw: A serious disease caused by a bug (bacteria) that lives in the soil. It causes muscles to spasm. Also called tetanus.
definitions.Lou Gehrig disease: A disease that attacks the nerve cells in your brain and spinal cord that carry messages to your muscles. Also called amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, ALS, or motor neuron disease.
definitions.low-density lipoprotein: A "bad" kind of fat in your blood that can lead to disease. Also calledLDL.
definitions.lower respiratory infections: Any diseases the occur in the lungs or voicebox, such as pneumonia, bronchitis, or tuberculosis.
definitions.lumpectomy: When a growth in your breast is removed with surgery. The growth may be cancerous or non-cancerous.
definitions.lung function: How well your lungs are working.
definitions.lungs: The 2 organs in your chest that help you breathe.
definitions.lupus: A disease where your immune system attacks healthy cells and tissues by mistake. There are several types of lupus and the kind that you have makes a difference in what body parts are affected.
definitions.Lyme disease: Caused by small bugs (parasites) that suck blood and can pass on disease.
definitions.lymph nodes: Glands that contain white blood cells that help protect you against germs.
definitions.lymphatic: Related to the lymph system, an important part of your immune system (helps to protect you against disease).
definitions.lymphedema: A type of swelling that occurs when a type of fluid (lymph) builds up.
definitions.lymphocytes: A kind of white blood cell that helps protect you against germs.
definitions.lymphoma: Cancer of lymphatic system, an important part of your immune system.
definitions.macular degeneration: An eye disease that destroys your sharp, central vision, which helps with seeing clearly and reading and driving.
definitions.magnetic resonance imaging (MRI): pictures of the inside of the body taken with a special machine, like an x-ray but more detailed
definitions.maintain: To take care of or support.
definitions.malaise: A general feeling of that you are sick or feel bad.
definitions.malaria: A disease that you get when you are bitten by a mosquito in certain parts of the world.
definitions.malignant neoplasms: Occurs when new cells grow rapidly, creating a growth or tumor, rather than simply replacing old cells with new ones. Malignant neoplasms are cancer. Also called malignant tumors.
definitions.malignant tumor: Occurs when new cells grow rapidly, creating a growth or tumor, rather than simply replacing old cells with new ones. Malignant tumors are cancer. Also called malignant neoplasms.
definitions.malingering: When you are pretending to be sick.
definitions.malocclusion: When your teeth do not fit together properly, such as when your teeth are crowded together or you have an overbite or an underbite.
definitions.mammogram: An X-ray picture of the breast, that is helpful in finding diseases.
definitions.manage: To control or be in charge of.
definitions.manner: The way in which something is done.
definitions.mastectomy: Surgery to remove part of all of a breast.
definitions.measles: An infection caused by a bug (a virus) that causes a rash over your body, with a fever, pink eye, and a runny nose. Also called rubeola.
definitions.medical facilities: Any place where medical treatmet is provided, such as your doctor’s office, hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and labs for patient test and procedures.
definitions.melatonin: Something made by the pineal gland that affects how well you sleep. Manmade and natural melatonin can be found in stores as pills.
definitions.memory cell: a cell that helps your body quickly fight diseases that you've gotten before
definitions.meningitis: Occurs when the thin tissue around the brain and spinal cord (called the meninges) becomes swollen. It can be caused by different germs (a virus or bacteria).
definitions.menopause: The time in a woman's life when her periods stop. Also known as "the change."
definitions.menses, menstruation: The normal bleeding that occurs as part of a woman's monthly cycle, if she does not become pregnant.
definitions.mental health condition: A very general phrase that includes any kind of illness that can affect your mood, thinking, or how you act.
definitions.metabolism, metabolize: How the body breaks down food into energy.
definitions.metastasize: To spread. Often used with cancer when it moves from one area of your body to another.
definitions.methods: How a science study was carried out.
definitions.mg: The short form for a very small measuring unit, the milligram.
definitions.microbes: Very tiny germs, like viruses or bacteria, that are too small too see.
definitions.microcephaly: A birth defect where the baby’s head is smaller in comparison to babies of the same sex and age. These babies often have smaller brains that might not have developed properly.
definitions.micrograms per deciliter: A way to tell how much lead is in your blood.
definitions.Middle East Respiratory Syndrome: A severe respiratory illness, caused by a germ (a virus), that involves the upper respiratory tract. Also called MERS.
definitions.mild: A disease or condition that is not severe.
definitions.mildew: A fungus that grows in warm, damp areas. They are sometimes harmful to your health.
definitions.miliaria: Occurs during hot, humd weather and is caused by locked sweat glands. Also known as prickly heat or heat rash.
definitions.miscarriage: When a baby is born too early (before 20 weeks) and dies.
definitions.mites: Very tiny, spider-like, animals that cause allergies and skin rashes
definitions.mitral valve prolapse: Occurs when the mitral valve doesn't close tightly. It is a common heart valve condition and sometimes causes regurgitation.
definitions.mitral valve stenosis: Occurs when the mitral valve between the 2 halves of the heart does not fully open, so less blood flows to the body.
definitions.mobile, mobility: To be able or have the ability to move around.
definitions.moderate: Something that is moderate or controllable or to control or limit.
definitions.molars: The 3 back teeth on each side of your upper and lower jaws, that help you to chew your food.
definitions.mold: Very small growths on food and damp surfaces. They can be harmful to your health.
definitions.mononeucleosis: Caused by a germ (the Epstein-Barr virus) that occurs more often in young adults. Often called the "kissing disease."
definitions.morbidity: Illness or the rate of illness in a group of people or an area, such as a state or country.
