definitions.mortality, mortality rate: The number of deaths in an area or group of people or the rate of death for a poulation.
definitions.motor neuron diseases: A group diseases that affect the nerve cells in your brain and spinal cord that carry messages to your muscles.
definitions.MRSA: A type of germ (a bacteria) that can't be treated with drugs (antibiotics). It causes a staph infection that is hard to treat. MRSA stands for methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus.
definitions.mucosal membranes: Soft, moist areas just inside the openings to your body. Also called mucous membranes.
definitions.mucus: A slimy substance, often seen in your nose and throat, but it can also be found in other areas of your body. Also called phlegm or snot.
definitions.multiple myeloma: When there are too many of plasma, a type of white blood cell.
definitions.multiple sclerosis: A disease that affects your brain and spinal cord, slowing down the messages from your brain to your body.
definitions.muscles: The soft tissues that help you to move and helps your body to work properly. They are in your arms and legs, but also your stomach and heart.
definitions.mutagen: Something that causes changes in your genes.
definitions.myocardial infarction: Occurs when the flow of blood to the heart is stopped by a blood clot or a spasm of an artery. Also called a heart attack or MI.
definitions.myocarditis: An inflammation of the heart muscle, caused by viral infections, autoimmune diseases, or medications.
definitions.myopia: When it’s hard to see things that are far away. Also called nearsightedness.
definitions.narcotic: A drug to treat moderate to severe pain. Also called opiates.
definitions.nausea, nauseous: When you have an upset stomach or feel like throwing up.
definitions.nearsightedness: When it’s hard to see things that are far away. Also called myopia.
definitions.nebulizer: A device that provides medicine for asthma in the form of a mist.
definitions.neonatal death: The death of an infant in the first month of life.
definitions.neonatal lupus: A disease where your body's immune system attacks healthy cells by mistake. Neonatal lupus is rare and affects newborn babies.
definitions.neonatologist: A doctor who focuses on babies who are born early or has complex problems.
definitions.nephritis: Inflammation of any part of the kidneys that can cause problems with kidney function.
definitions.nephropathy: A kidney disease. Can be a complication of diabetes.
definitions.nephrosis: Symptoms that indicate kidney damage, resulting from a problem with the kidneys’ filters (called glomeruli). It is caused by a variety of diseases, most commonly diabetes and lupus. Also called nephrotic syndrome.
definitions.nephrotic syndrome: Symptoms that indicate kidney damage, resulting from a problem with the kidneys’ filters (called glomeruli). It is caused by a variety of diseases, most commonly diabetes and lupus. Also called nephrosis.
definitions.nervous system: A person’s brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Your nervous system controls your thinking, feeling, smelling, touching, seeing, hearing, and moving.
definitions.neuraminidase: An enzyme on the surface of a virus.
definitions.neurologic, neurological: Related to the nervous system, brain, or spinal cord.
definitions.neurology: The study of the nervous system.
definitions.neuropathy: A disease of the nervous system, especially the hands and feet.
definitions.niacin: A B vitamin that helps lower "bad" fats (LDL and triglycerides) in your blood and raise "good" fats (HDL). Use with changes in your diet or other drugs, niacin can help protect you from heart disease, heart attack, and stroke.
definitions.nominal: Something that is small or not important or cheap rather than costly.
definitions.nonalcoholic fatty liver disease: Occurs when fat builds up in your liver and it does not work as well as it should. Also called NAFLD.
definitions.noncompliant: If you do not following a treatment plan.
definitions.noninvasive: Without using surgery or needles or cutting the skin. In cancer, a type that does not spread.
definitions.nonpharmaceutical intervention: Ways to stop the spread of illness without drugs, such as hand washing, covering sneezes, closing schools, and so on.
definitions.nosocomial: An infection that you catch in the hospital.
definitions.notification, notify: To tell or let someone know.
definitions.NSAIDs: NSAIDs, or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, reduce pain by reducing swelling in your body. There are several names for these drugs, including the over-the-counter NSAIDs aspirin, naproxen, and ibuprofen. Some NSAIDs are prescription only, such as celecoxib.
definitions.numerous: Many or a lot of things or people.
definitions.nutrient: Come from food, including proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water.
definitions.nutritious: Food that is good for you, or healthy food.
definitions.obese, obesity: To be dangerously overweight or too heavy.
definitions.obligate, obligation: To require that you do something.
definitions.obscure: Something that is hidden or unclear.
definitions.obstetrician: A doctor who cares for women who are expecting a baby.
definitions.obstruct, obstruction: To block or close an opening.
definitions.obvious: To clear or easy to see or understand.
definitions.occasionally: Sometimes, or once in a while.
definitions.occlusal: To chew or grind the surface of your back teeth.
definitions.occupant: A person who lives in a building.
definitions.occupation, occupational: A job or the work that you do.
definitions.occupational therapist: A person trained to help people who are sick or injured learn or relearn the things you do everyday.
definitions.occupational therapy: The kind of treatment that helps you relearn everyday activities.
definitions.occurrence: An event or soemthing that happens.
definitions.on an empty stomach: Do not eat or drink before taking a drug.
definitions.open bite: When your top and bottom front teeth or back teeth do not touch, even when your mouth is closed.
definitions.opportunistic infection: An infection that you get because you are already weak.
definitions.opposite: To be at the other end or side of a room or for one thing to be very different from another.
definitions.optic neuritis: An eye disease, when the nerve (optic nerve) that sends information from your eye to your brain and makes it difficult to see.
definitions.oral administration: Something that is given by mouth.
definitions.oral consent: When you say that it is OK for the doctor to do a test or procedure.
definitions.oral prophylaxis: Basic teeth cleaning with a toothbrush and toothpaste.
definitions.oral surgery: An operation or surgery in your mouth.
definitions.orchitis: Swelling of 1 or both testicles. It is often a side effect of mumps.
definitions.orthodontia: The treatment of problems of spacing of your teeth.
definitions.orthodontic: Related to braces or teeth straightening.
definitions.orthodontist: A dentist who treats problems with spacing of your teeth or jaws.
definitions.orthopedic surgeon: A doctor who treats patients with problems in their bones and joints through surgery.
definitions.orthotic: Items that are used to support your foot or ankle, such as foot pads or ankle braces.
definitions.osteonecrosis: When a bone dies because it loses blood flow.
definitions.osteopenia: When your bones lose strength, but not as much as when you have osteoporosis.
definitions.osteoporosis: When your bones are weak break easily. Also called brittle done disease.
definitions.otitis media: Ear infection, often in the middle ear.
definitions.otolaryngologist: A doctor who treats diseases in your ear, nose, and throat.
definitions.outbreak: The start or increase in the number of cases of a disease.
definitions.outermost: Something that is farthest away or on the outside.
definitions.ova, ovum: The eggs produced in a woman's ovaries.
definitions.ovary, ovaries: The 2 glands that produce eggs (or ova) and are located near the womb.
definitions.overbite: When your front upper teeth go beyond your lower teeth. Also called "bucktoothed" or retrognathism.
definitions.overweight: When you weigh too much for how tall you are.
definitions.pain: An unplesant feeling, a sign from your nerves that something may be wrong. It ca be sharp or dull, sting, burn, or ache.
definitions.pain relievers: There are different types of pain relievers that can help you deal with too much pain. Some you can buy in a store (over-the-counter or OTC); for some, you need a precription. OTC medications are acetaminophen (Tylenol) and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), such as aspirin, naproxen (Aleve), and ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin). Prescription drugs are divided into opioid or non-opioid categories. Opioid drugs include codeine and morphine; non-opioid drugs include lidocaine and gabapentin.
definitions.palatable: When food or drink is tasty or good.
definitions.palliative care: To treat the discomfort, symptoms, and stress of serious illness.
definitions.pallor: When your skin is more pale than usual.
definitions.palpate: When a doctor feels a part of your body to check if it is normal or not.
definitions.palpitation: When you feel that you your heart is beating fast.
definitions.pancreas: A gland behind the stomach that helps with digestion.
definitions.pancreatitis: When the pancreas is swollen and irritated by its own fluids.
definitions.pandemic: A large outbreak that moves across a large area, such as many countries or continents.
definitions.panic disorder: When you get very anxious and feel that you are losing control.
definitions.panzootic: A disease that iaffects animals over a large area.
definitions.papule: A firm raised spot on your skin.
definitions.paralysis: When parts of your body cannot move. It can be your whole body or just a part of it.
definitions.parameter: The facts or values that define sometrhing.
definitions.paraplegia: When the lower half of your body cannot move.
definitions.parasite: An animal or plant that lives off another animal or plant.
definitions.parasitic diseases: Diseases caused by small bugs (parasites) that use other living things, such as your body, for food and a place to live. You can get them from contaminated food or water, a bug bite, or sexual contact. Some common diseases spread by parasites are malaria and toxoplasmosis.
definitions.parasomnia: When you act in unusual ways when you are asleep, such as walking, talking, or eating.
definitions.parathyroid gland: Controls how much of the mineral calcium your body has.
definitions.paresthesia: When your skin feels prickly or burning or there is no feeling, and there is no reason for this feeling.
definitions.Parkinson's disease: A movement disorder that occurs when the brain does not produce enough of a chemical.
definitions.participant, participate: To take part in an event.
definitions.passive immunity: When a baby is protected from disease by its mother. This lasts 6 to 12 months.
definitions.passive smoking: When you inhale smoke from someone else's cigarette, cigar, or pipe. Also called secondhand smoke.
definitions.paternity testing: A test (a genetic test) done on blood or tissue to determine if 2 people are related.
definitions.pathogen: A germ or other agent that causes diseases.
definitions.Pb: The short way of writing the word "lead."
definitions.peak flow: How fast you can blow out air. Measured by a peak flow meter.
definitions.peak flow meter: A small tool that is used to measure how fast you can blow out air.
definitions.pediatrician: A doctor who treats babies and children.
definitions.pediatrics: The study of illnesses in children.
definitions.peeling paint: Old paint that is starting to come off of a wall, ceiling, or other surface.
definitions.pelvic floor disorders: Muscles and other tissues that hold many organs in place, such as the womb and bladder, so that they work properly. If they get stretched or hurt, it can cause problems when you pee for example.
definitions.pelvic inflammatory disease: When a woman's reproductive organs, like the womb, are infected and swollen. Also called PID
definitions.pelvis: A bowl-shaped set of bones that connects the upper part of your body with your legs.
definitions.peptic ulcers: A sore on the lining of your stomach or the first part of your small interstine . Also called stomach ulcers.
definitions.perforation: A hole that develops into an organ.
definitions.perform: To do or carry out an action.
definitions.pericarditis: The swelling of the tissues around your heart, caused by infections, diseases, or medications.
definitions.perimenopause: The time shortly before the "change of life" (or menopause).
definitions.perinatal: The weeks right before and after a baby is born.
definitions.perinatal death: The death of a baby right before or after it is born.
definitions.perinatologist: A doctor who treats pregnant women who have health problems or whose unborn children do.
definitions.periodontal disease: When your gums are red and swollen. Also called gum disease. There are 2 types: gingivitis and periodontitis.
definitions.periodontitis: A more serious form of gum disease that can lead to infection and the loss of bone in your jaw.
definitions.peritoneum: The thin lining of your belly area.
definitions.permanent teeth: The 32 teeth that push out your primary teeth and that last during your life.
definitions.permit, permissable: To allow or let you do or have something.
definitions.persevere: To keep trying or not give up.
definitions.personal protective equipment: Clothing that protects health workers from germs or from bits of dangerous chemicals or noises. This includes gowns, face shields, gloves, face masks, and respirators. Also called PPE.
definitions.personnel: Staff or people whowork in an organization.
definitions.perspiration, perspire: Sweat, the clear, salty liquid produced by glands in your skin. Sweating is how your body cools itself.
definitions.PET scan: An imaging test that looks at how your body is working. Also called a positron emission tomography scan.
definitions.petechiae: Tiny red or purple spots on your skin that are caused by bleeding under your skin.
definitions.pharmacist: Someone who is trained to prepare and give out medicine and to talk to you about how to use them in the right way.
definitions.pharmacotherapy: Using drugs to treat a disease or condition.
definitions.phenylketonuria: A disease that means your body can't process something that is in most food. Because this condition can lead to serious health problems, all babies are tested when they are born. Also called PKU.
definitions.photosensitive: When nyour skin is too sensitive to light, especially sunlight.
definitions.physical activity: When you move your body, especially exercise,like walking or running.
definitions.physical therapist: Someone who is trained to treat pain and weakness by exercises.
definitions.physical therapy: The treatment of pain and weakness with exercise.
definitions.physical, physically: Relating to your body or an object. Something that is real.
definitions.pica: Eating something that is not food, like dirt or clay.
definitions.pictographs: When a picture or symbol is used instead of a word.
definitions.PID: When a woman's reproductive organs, like the womb, are infected and swollen. Also called pelvic inflammatory disease.
definitions.pimples: A skin condition when the space where hairs grow get clogged up with oil and dead skin cells.
definitions.pinkeye: An infection around your eyes. Also called conjunctivitis.
definitions.pit and fissure sealant: A thin layer of plastic painted onto teeth to prevent decay. Also called dental sealant.
definitions.pituitary disorders: When you have too much or too little of certain hormones, substances that tell different body parts what to do.
definitions.pituitary gland: Controls other glands (like the thyroid) and also how you grow.
definitions.placebo: A pill that doesn’t have any drugs or medicine used in research to help show that a medication works. Also called “sugar” pill.
definitions.placenta: The part of the mother’s womb that supplies oxygen and nutrition to her unborn baby.
definitions.plague: A disease caused by a germ (bacteria) carried by rats and the fleas that live on them.
definitions.plantar fasciitis: When the thick tissue on the bottom of your foot (called plantar fascia) gets swollen.
definitions.plaque (in an artery): A fatty deposit in your arteries that means they don't work as well.
definitions.plaque (on teeth): A sticky film of germs on your teeth. When it gets hard, it becomes tartar.
definitions.plasma: The liquid part of your blood.
definitions.pleurisy: When the lining of your lungs and chest are swollen (inflammed).
definitions.pneumococcal Infections: Caused by a specific germ (a bacteria). Includes diseases like ear and sinus infections, pneumonia, and meningitis.
definitions.pneumonia: An infection in one or both lungs.
definitions.pneumonitis: When your lung tissues are swollen. Nt a disease that you get by a germ.
definitions.PO: Letters that mean to take by mouth.
definitions.podiatrist: Someone who is trained to treat the problems of your feet.
definitions.poison: Something that can harm or kill a person if it is swallowed or breathed in.
definitions.poison ivy, oak, or sumac: These plants have liquids that cause swelling and itchiness on your skin if you touch them.
definitions.polio: A disease that is caused by a germ (a virus) that can cause pain and paralysis in parts of the body. Also called poliomyelitis.
definitions.poliomyelitis: A disease that is caused by a germ (a virus) that can cause pain and paralysis in parts of the body. Also known as polio
definitions.pollute, polluted: When something is dirty or poisoned.
definitions.polycystic ovary syndrome: Happens when a woman's ovaries or adrenal glands produce more male hormones than normal. Causes fluid-filled sacs (or cysts) to grow on the ovaries. Also called PCOS.
definitions.polysaccharide vaccine: A kind of vaccine that uses the sugar around the germ to provide protection against the germ.
definitions.portion: A part of a larger object.
definitions.positron emission tomography scan: An imaging test that looks at how your body is working. Also called a PET scan.
definitions.postexposure prophylaxis: A drug that is given to someone who has been near someone who is sick or may be near someone who is sick to prevent a disease.
definitions.postoperative: After surgery. Also called recovery from surgery.
definitions.postpartum depression: When you feel overwhelmed, depressed, or sad for no reason after having a baby. Also called baby blues or post-pregnancy depression.
definitions.postpolio syndrome: A condition that some people who have had polio develop later in life. Symptoms includ tiredness, new muscle weakness, and muscle and joint pain much later in life.
definitions.precaution: Something to help keep you safe or well.
definitions.preclinical: A disease that isn’t causing symptoms yet.
definitions.prediabetes: When your blood sugar is higher than normal, but is not high enough for you to have diabetes. If you have prediabetes, you are at a higher risk of developing type 2 diabetes.
definitions.predisposed, predisposition: Likely to or inclined to develop a disease or condition.
definitions.pregnancy: When you are expecting a baby.
definitions.premenstrual yndrome: A group of symptoms the you may get 1 to 2 weeks before your period and that are strong enough that they get in the way of you doing your everydaay tasks.
definitions.premolars: The teeth right behind the canine teeth. They help to grind food. Also called bicuspids.
definitions.preparedness: To be ready or to have a plan.
definitions.prepuce: The foreskin of the penis. It is removed when a person is circumcised.
definitions.presbycusis: When you have trouble hearing sounds or can't hear any sounds at all. Also called hearing impairment or hearing disorders..
definitions.presbyopia: When you can't see close up as you get older.
definitions.prescriber: A trained medical person who can write prescriptions, usually a doctor, nurse, or physician assistant.
definitions.prescription: An order from your doctor, nurse, or physician assistant for drugs or other treatment.
definitions.present with: In medicine, the symptoms you have or tell your doctor.
definitions.pressure sores: Areas of skin where a sore is created when you stay in one position and don't move for too long. They often form where your bones are close to your skin, like your back or your heels.
definitions.prevalence, prevalent: The number of people who are sick with a certain disease within a community. Also used when a disease is widespread over certain areas.
definitions.prevent, preventable, prevention: To stop or keep from happening.
definitions.preventative, preventive: Things that you can do to help keep you well, such as getting a flu vaccine each year or eating fruits and vegetables.
definitions.primary teeth: Baby teeth, the first teeth that appear. There are 20 primary teeth. They fall out and are replaced by permanent teeth. Also called milk teeth or primary teeth.
definitions.principal investigator: The scientist in charge of a research project.
definitions.prioritize: To decide which of a number of things or tasks should be done first.
definitions.proactive: To take action on your own.
definitions.probability: The chance or how likely something is to happen.
definitions.procedure: A process or way of doing something.
definitions.prodromal: The time between when the first symptoms appear and when the disease completely appears.
definitions.prohibit, prohibitive, prohibited from: To not allow you to do something.
definitions.projectile: An object flies through the air or a thrown object.
definitions.prone: Lying face down or on your stomach.
definitions.prophylaxis: Something that prevents disease or infection, such as drugs taken before travel to prevent malaria, or shots given after an animal bite to prevent rabies.
definitions.prostate: A gland in the male body that makes semen.
definitions.prostate cancer: A common kind of cancer located in the prostate gland.
definitions.prostate-specific antigen test: A test that checks the health of your prostate. Also called the PSA test.
definitions.prostatitis: When your prostate is swollen because of an infection.
definitions.prosthesis: An artificial body part, such as a man-made arm or leg.
definitions.prosthodontia: The study of problems of people with missing teeth or other problems in their jaws using crowns, dentures, or other devices.
definitions.prosthodontists: A dentist who treats people who have missing teeth or other problems in their jaws using crowns, dentures, or other devices.
definitions.protocol: A step-by-step process or rules for doing something.
definitions.provider: A doctor, nurse, or other person who takes care of your health.
definitions.proximal: Something that is closer to the center of the body.
definitions.proximity: To be near by or close to something.
definitions.PSA blood test: A test that checks the health of your prostate. Also called the prostate-specific antigen test.
definitions.psoriasis: A skin disease that gives you a dry, scaly, rash.
definitions.psoriatic arthritis: Causes pain, stiffness, and swelling in your joints. Sometimes you will also develop the skin rash of psoraisis.
definitions.psychiatrist: A doctor whofocuses on your mental health. Also called a "shrink."
definitions.psychosocial: Including both the mental and social aspects of disease.
definitions.psychotropic: Drugs that affect a person's mind. Also call mind-altering drugs.
definitions.PTSD: A mental health disorder that some people develop after they experience or see a traumatic event, such as war, a car crash, or an earthquake. Also called post-traumatic stress disoder.
definitions.public health: A type of vaccine that uses a weak form of the germ that causes the disease, like the measles, mumps, rubella vaccine.
definitions.pulmonary care unit: The part of the hospital where lung diseases are treated.
definitions.pulmonary embolism: When a blood clot blocks in an artery in your lung suddenly.
definitions.pulmonary fibrosis: A disease that occurs when your lung tissues are scarred and don't work as well.
definitions.pulmonologist: A doctor who treats and studies lung diseases.
definitions.pulp: When the tissues deep inside your lung are scarred and so don't work as well.
definitions.pulpectomy: To remove all tissue, including the nerve, from your tooth.
definitions.pulpitis: When the tisssues inside your tooth are infected.
definitions.pulpotomy: When some, but not all of the tissue inside a tooth is taken out. It most often is done on children's teeth.
definitions.pyrexia: A body temperature that is higher than normal. Also called fever.
definitions.quadriplegia: When your arms and legs cannot move on their own.
definitions.qualified: Has the training to perform a task.
definitions.quarantine: To keep people who are sick or who have been exposed to a disease away from other people, to help control the spread of a disease.
definitions.questionnaire: A survey or series of questions.
definitions.RA: Rheumatoid arthritis, disease of your joints.
definitions.rabies: A very serious disease that people get from a bite from a sick animal.
definitions.radiation therapy: A kind of cancer treatment that uses strong X-rays to kill cancer cells. Also called radiotherapy or brachytherapy.
definitions.radioisotope: A type of chemical that is used to in medicine to diagnose and treat disease. Also called radionuclide.
definitions.radiologist: A doctor who diagnoses and treats people using X-rays.
definitions.radiology: The study of diseases using X-rays.
definitions.radon: A gas that you can't smell or taste that can cause illness if you live with high levels of it inside a building.
definitions.random sample: A group of people chosen by chance, like drawing names out of a hat.
definitions.randomization, randomized: To be assigned to a group by chance, like drawing names out of a hat.
definitions.range: The difference between low and high numbers.
definitions.rapid diagnostic test: A test that gives a fast result to see someone is sick.
definitions.rashes: An area of skin that is itchy or swollen.
definitions.Raynaud's disease: A disease where the blood vessels in your fingers and toes get narrow when you are cold or stressed. This means that blood can't get to the surface and causes your skin to change color.
definitions.recall: To have toys or other things returned to the factory where they were made, usually because they are dangerous.
definitions.recover: To get better after being sick.
definitions.recuperate: To get better after being sick.
definitions.recur: To happen again or come back.
definitions.reduce: To make something smaller or weaker.
definitions.redundant: Something that is extra or not needed.
definitions.referral: To see another doctor to get a second opinion.
definitions.refills: To fill a container again or to get more medicine from the drugstore.
definitions.reflux: When food or drink flows back from your stomach into your throat.
definitions.refractory: A disease that is hard to treat or manage.
definitions.regardless: In any case or no matter.
definitions.register: To sign up or sign in.
definitions.regulate: To control or make rules about.
definitions.regurgitation: When something, like blood or food, leaks back through a valve in the wrong direction.
definitions.rehabilitate: To get better or restore movement.
definitions.relief: To feel better or more comfortable.
definitions.remediation: Fixing or getting rid of a health hazard.
definitions.remission: When a disease has gone away.
definitions.replicable: Something that can be done again.
definitions.researchers: People who study questions of health or science.
definitions.residual seizure disorder: A seizure (or fit) that happens shortly after a child has been vaccinated, with more seizures in the months following.
definitions.resin: A kind of material that is used when your teeth are fixed.
definitions.respirator: A face mask with a special air filter that will keep you from breathing in dangerous lead dust and other chemicals.
definitions.respiratory therapist: Care for people who have trouble breathing.
definitions.restless leg syndrome: A tingling or prickly feeling in your legs. You also feel that you must move your legs.
definitions.restoration: In dentistry, to fix or replace a tooth by a filling, a crown, or putting in a fake tooth.
definitions.retinal detachment: When part of your eye pulls away from its normal position.
definitions.retinoblastoma: A rare cancer of the eye in children.
definitions.retinol: Vitamin A, an important vitamin in how well you see and grow.
definitions.retrospective study: A study that looks at a series of events that have already happened.
definitions.review: To go over something again or check.
definitions.revise, revised, revision: To look at again and to change.
definitions.Reye syndrome: A disease that occurs only you have had another infection. It affects the blood, liver, and brain, mostly in children. Also called Reye's syndrome.
definitions.rh incompatibility: A condition that occurs when you are pregnant if you have Rh-negative blood and your baby has Rh-positive blood.
definitions.rheumatoid arthritis: A kind of joint disease that causes pain and swelling.
definitions.rheumatologist: A doctor who treats diseases of the joints, bones, and immune system.
definitions.rheumatology: The study of the immune system, joints, and bones.
definitions.rickets: A disease that causes soft bones in children if they don't get enough
definitions.rigorous: Something that is accurate or a process that is done in an exact or strict way.
definitions.ringworm: A red rash in the shape of a circle, caused by a germ (a fungus). It is not caused by a worm.
definitions.risk: The chance that you will develop a specific health problem.
definitions.risk assessment: A way to find out a chance of a person or group having a health problem.
definitions.risk factor: Something that increases your chances of getting hurt or sick.
definitions.root canal: To remove the nerve and infection from inside the root of a tooth.
definitions.root planing and scaling: Deep cleaning of your teeth and their roots when you have gum disease.
definitions.rotator cuff injuries: Your rotator cuff is in your shoulder. It helps your shoulder to move and also to be stable. Injuries (muscle tears) can happen from an accident or from playing sports.
definitions.rotavirus: A germ (a virus) that causes you to feel sick to your stomach, throw up, or have diarrhea.
definitions.rubella: An infection caused by a germ (a virus) that usually has a mild fever and rash. Also called "German" or three-day measles.
definitions.rubeola: An infection caused by a germ (a virus) that causes a rash over your body, with a fever, pink eye, and a runny nose. Also called measles.
definitions.saliva: Spit. It is made in salivary glands and keeps your food moist and helps to digest it.
definitions.salivary glands: Are located in your mouth. There are large and small glands. They create saliva (spit).
definitions.salmonella: A goups of germs (bacteria) that can be found in raw foods and sometimes in pets that can make you very sick.
definitions.sanitary: Something that is clean or free of germs.
definitions.sanitize: To clean very well or make germ-free.
definitions.satisfactory: When something is okay or good.
definitions.scabies: An itchy skin condition caused by a tiny bug (called a mite).
definitions.scaling and root planing: A deep cleaning of your teeth that removes hard and soft deposits on teeth above and below your gums.
definitions.scarlatina: Scarlet fever, a disease caused by a germ (or virus) that gives you a red rash.
definitions.scarlet fever: A disease caused by a germ (or virus) that gives you a red rash. Also called scarlatina.
definitions.schedule: To plan a time to do something.
definitions.sclerosis: When tissues in your body get hard and thick.
definitions.screening: A medical test to find out if a person has a disease or illness.
definitions.seasonal affective disorder: A kind of sadness that comes in fall and winter. Also called SAD.
definitions.second- and third-order effects: Things that happen as a result of one action.
definitions.secondary hypertension: Occurs when the low pressure (diastolic) is 90 or higher or the high pressure (systolic) is 140 or higher. Caused by another medical condition or medicine..
definitions.sedative: A drug that you take to make you feel calm or less anxious.
definitions.sedentary: When you are inactive. Also called being a couch potato.
definitions.segment: A part or piece of something.
definitions.seizure: Uncontrolled movements caused by unusual activity in your brain.
definitions.sensitive: Something or someone that is easily hurt or sore.
definitions.sepsis: A very serious infection in your blood caused by a germ (a bacteria). Also called septicemia.
definitions.septicemia: A very serious infection in your blood caused by a germ (a bacteria). Also called sepsis.
definitions.sequentially: Items in a row, actions that occur in order.
definitions.seroconversion: When you become immune to a disease or show signs of the disease after being infected.
definitions.serology: A test that looks for the strength of a reaction to a disease or substance.
definitions.serosurvey: A test to see how likely you are to get a disease.
definitions.severe: Something that is strong or dangerous.
definitions.shingles: A disease that causes painful sores on your skin. It is caused by the same bug (or virus) that causes chickenpox. Also called herpes zoster.
definitions.shortness of breath: When you have a hard time breathing.
definitions.side effect: When you have a reaction, such as a rach, to a medicine.
definitions.sinusitis: When your sinuses (the hole areas around the bones in your face, are infected.
definitions.Sjogren's syndrome: A disease the glands that make tears and saliva don't work well. This makes your eyes and mouth dry.
definitions.skull: The bones of your head bones.
definitions.sleep apnea: When you stop breathing for 10 seconds or more when you sleep.
definitions.social distancing: Ways to try to keep a disease from spreading by asking them to stay at home or stay away from large group sof people.
definitions.socialize: To meet or talk with people.
definitions.soft tissue sarcoma: An uncommon type of cancer in tissues like muscles, tendons, and blood vessels.
definitions.source: The cause of something. The place where something started.
definitions.spasm: The sudden, strong tightening or jerk of a muscle.
definitions.species: A group of plants or animals with similar traits.
definitions.sperm: The sex cell produced by males.
definitions.spine: Protects your spinal cord and allows you to stand and bend. Also known as backbone.
definitions.spirometer: A device that measures how much air you breathg in and out.
definitions.spleen: An organ in your belly that helps fight diseases and balance fluids in your body.
definitions.spontaneous: An action that is unplanned or sudden.
definitions.sprain: When the tissues that connect bones are stretched or torn.
definitions.SQ: A shot that goes into the fat right under your skin. Also called sub-Q.
definitions.stakeholders: A person or group with an interest or concern in something.
definitions.stamina: To get through a disease or a difficult physical activity, such as running a marathon.
definitions.state: To say or tell. In medicine, how you are doing.
definitions.statins: A type of drug that lowers the amount of cholesterol in your blood. There are many names for these drugs, including atorvastatin, simvastatin, and rosuvastatin.
definitions.status: The state or condition that you or something else is in.
definitions.STDs: Illnesses that are passed from one person to another through sex. They are caused by different germs (bacteria, parasites, and viruses). There are many types, like chlamydia and gonorrhea.
definitions.stenosis: When something, like a vein or your spine, gets more narrow.
definitions.sterile: To be unable to have children or to be very clean.
definitions.sterilization: Medical procedure for women (having your tubes tied, also called tubal ligation) or men (vasectomy) that permanently prevents pregnancy. Also means "clean" when applied to medical instruments.
definitions.steroid: A kind of drug that reduces swelling and helps your body’s natural defense against sickness (your immune system). Also called corticosteroids or glucocorticoids.
definitions.stigma: When people treat you in an unkind way because of a disease that you have.
definitions.stillbirth: When the baby dies after 20 weeks of growing. Also called stillborn.
definitions.stomach: The place in your upper belly where food is first broken down (digested). It is between the tube that takes food from your mouth to your stomach (esophagus) and your small intestine.
definitions.stomach ulcers: Causes swelling and sores (also called ulcers), in the lining of the rectum and colon.
definitions.strabismus: When both of your eyes do not look in the same direction. Also called walleye.
definitions.strain: When the muscles or tissue that connects muscles to bones is stretched or torn. Can also be a specific type of germ, animal, or plant.
definitions.strategy, strategize: A plan or to make a plan.
definitions.streptococcus: A specific germ (a bacteria). Also called strep.
definitions.stress: Stress or strain (can be of your mind or body), pressure, or worry.
definitions.stroke: A stroke, bleeding that occurs in your brain. Also called cerebral accident or cerebrovascular accident or CVA. An ischemic stroke, caused by a blood clot that blocks a blood vessel in the brain. A hemorrhagic stroke is caused by a blood vessel that breaks and bleeds into the brain.
definitions.subacute cutaneous lupus: A disease where your body's immune system attacks healthy cells by mistake. Subacute cutaneous lupus causes sores after being out in the sun
definitions.subclinical infection: When you have an illness, but don't feel or look sick.
definitions.subcutaneous: A shot that goes into the fat right under your skin. Also called sub-Q.
definitions.sublingual: Medicine that is put under the tongue.
definitions.sudden infant death syndrome: The sudden, unexplained death of a baby less than one year old. Also called SIDS or crib death.
definitions.suffocate: To choke or not be able to breathe.
definitions.suggest, suggests: Something that might be done or could be true.
definitions.sun protection: The different ways that you can protect your skin from the sun. IThis includes staying out of the sun, wearing shirts with long sleeves or hats, or using a lotion with a chemical in it to block light rays (suncreen).
definitions.sun protection factor: A number that tells you how well a sunscreen will work over a short amount of time.
definitions.superficial: Something that is not important or that is on the surface of the skin or jusr below it.
definitions.supersede: To replace or take the place of something.
definitions.supplement: To add to or be in addition to. Can also refer to vitamins or minerals.
definitions.supply: An amount of something (like food or water) that is kept on hand.
definitions.surface: The outside or top of something.
definitions.surge capacity: To be able to offer more services quickly in an emergency.
definitions.surgery: To change the organs or tissues in your body through cutting. Also called an operation.
definitions.surgical mask: A mask that covers part of the face of a doctor who performs surgery.
definitions.surveillance: To keep a close eye on or watch closely by collecting information on diseases or conditions in a community.
definitions.sustenance: Food and drink to support life.ood
definitions.sutures: Stitches to close up a cut, such as an injury or when you have surgery.
definitions.symptom: A sign of disease or sickness.
definitions.symptomatic: When you have symptoms, such as pain or fever, of a disease.
definitions.syncope: When you "black out" (or lose conciousness) for a short period of time. Also called fainting.
definitions.systematic: Something that is planned or regular.
definitions.systemic: Something that is all through your body.
definitions.systemic lupus erythematosus: A disease where the immune system of your body attacks healthy tissue by mistake (autoimmune). It can be mild or severe and can affect many parts of the body.
definitions.tap: A medical procedure that uses a needle to take out fluid from a bone or organ.
definitions.tap water: Water that comes from your sink faucet.
definitions.taper: To reduce or slow down the amount of a medication.
definitions.tartar: A crust on your teeth made from plaque that has hardened.
definitions.taste buds: Small bumps on your tongue that let you taste sweet, salty, sour, and bitter.
definitions.Tay-Sachs disease: An uncommon disease that you get from your parents that causes mental and physical problems.
definitions.teeth, tooth: The 32 bone-like objects in our jaw.
definitions.temperature: How hot your body is. When your temprature is high, you have a fever.
definitions.temporal arteritis: When the arteries in your head, neck and arms are swollen, so that the blood does not flow well. Also called giant cell arteritis.
definitions.temporal association: When two things happen at the same time, but are not actually related to each other.
definitions.temporomandibular joint dysfunction: When the muscles around this joint that connects your jaw to the side of your head are not working well. Also called TMD or TMJ dysfunction.
definitions.tendinitis: When the tissues that connect muscles to bones swell and cause pain.
definitions.teratogenic: Something that causes or is related problems that can hurt your baby before it is born.
definitions.terminal: A disease that cannot be cured or is fatal.
definitions.testes: Makes the male hormone (testosterone) and sperm.
definitions.testicular cancer: Cancer that affects the organs that make male sex hormones and sperm.
definitions.testicular disorders: Swelling of the testicles from injury or disease.
definitions.tetanus: A serious disease caused by a bug (bacteria) that lives in the soil. It causes muscles to spasm. Also called lockjaw.
definitions.therapeutic: Something that helps with healing a condition or disease.
definitions.therapeutic modality: The different ways of treating muscle injuries, including heat, cold, water baths, and more.
definitions.third molars: The last teeth to come into your mouth. Also called wisdom teeth.
definitions.thrombocytopenia: When the number of the small cells that are important in blood clotting (platelets) are low. This can cause unusual bleeding.
definitions.thrombus: A blood clot that stays where it has formed in your body.
definitions.thyroid: A gland in your neck that is shaped like a butterfly. It makes hormones that help your body work normally.
definitions.tick bites: Small bugs (paracites) that suck blood and can pass on diseases, including Lyme disease or Rocky Mountain spotted fever.
definitions.tinnitus: Noise in your ears that does not come from outside of your body. Also called ringing in the ears.
definitions.titer: A blood test that finds how much of a substance, like an immunization, remains in your body.
definitions.titrate: To find the or change the dose or level of a medicine.
definitions.tongue: The organ inside your mouth that helps you to taste, swallow, chew, and speak.
definitions.tonsillitis: When your tonsils, lumps of tissue at the back of your throat, are swollen.
definitions.topical, topical application: Something that is on is applied to the surface of your body.
definitions.torso: The main part of your body not including head, arms, or legs. Also called your trunk.
definitions.Tourette syndrome: When you make unusual movements or sounds.
definitions.toxic, toxin: Something that is dangerous or a poison.
definitions.toxicity: When something is harmful or causes bad side effects.
definitions.toxigenic: A germ (bacteria or mold) that creates a poisonous substance that can make people sick.
definitions.toxoplasmosis: A disease caused by a small bug (parasite). You can get it from cat litter, infected meat, and other sources. If you are pregnant or your immune system does not work well, this disease can be very serious.
definitions.trachea: The tube that comes from your mouth to your lungs. Also called "windpipe."
definitions.traditional medicine: Plants or things found in nature used to cure illness. Often comes from other countries or cultures. Also know as folk medicine or a home remedy.
definitions.transdermal: Through the skin, as when medicine is put in a patch that is worn on your body.
definitions.transient ischemic attack: Happens when the blood supply to the brain is blocked briefly. Also called a TIA.
definitions.transmit, transmitted, transmission: To send or pass on to others .
definitions.transparent: Something that is clear or see-through.
definitions.transplant, transplantation: When an organ or tissue from someone else's body is put into your body.
definitions.transverse myelitis: When swelling of the spinal cord causes a problem with signals between the spine and other parts of your body.
definitions.traumatic: An event that is shocking or upsetting.
definitions.traumatic brain injury: Caused by a bump or blow to the head, often by car accidents or war. Concussion is the mildest type. Also called TBI.
definitions.treat: To give care or take care of.
definitions.treatment: Any action, medicine, or other therapy to treat or cure a disease.
definitions.tremor: When part of your body is shaking or trembling and you can't control it.
definitions.trichomoniasis: A disease that you get through sex, caused by a a small bug (a parasite). Also called trich.
definitions.triglycerides: The most common type of fat in your body. If you have a high level, it can increase the chance that you will develop heart diseases.
definitions.trimester: Three months. Pregnancy is divided into 3 trimesters.
definitions.tubal ligation: A type of surgery that prevents a woman from getting pregnant. Also called "getting your tubes tied."
definitions.tuberculosis: An infection caused by a bacteria, often located in the lungs. Also called TB.
definitions.tumor: A growth or lump in your body. It may be cancer, but it also may not be cancer.
definitions.ulcer: An open sore that can develop in many areas of your body.
definitions.ulcerative colitis: Causes inflammation and sores (also called ulcers), in the lining of the rectum and colon.
definitions.ultrasound: A type of imaging that uses high sound waves to see things inside your body.
definitions.underbite: When your lower teeth extend past your upper front teeth. One type of malocclusion, when your teeth do not fit together properly.
definitions.undergo: To go through anexperience or procedure.
definitions.underweight: To be below a weight that is seen as normal.
definitions.unfavorable: Something that should not be done.
definitions.upper respiratory infections: Any diseases the occur above the neck, such as the common cold, sinus infections, laryngitis, or tonsilitis.
definitions.ureters: The tubes that carry waste or water from your kidneys to your bladder.
definitions.urethra: A tube that carries urine out of your body.
definitions.urinalysis: A test of your urine to check for diseases, such as diabetes, urinary tract infections, or kidney problems.
definitions.urinary incontinence: When you lose control of your bladder and the fluids it holds.
definitions.urinary tract infections: A common infection any where in the body's waste and excess water "drainage" system (urinary tract). This includes kidneys, ureter, bladder, and urethra. Also called a UTI.
definitions.urinate, urination: Water and waste that has passed through your kidneys and bladder. Also called pee.
definitions.urticaria: An itchy red rash on your skin. Also called hives.
definitions.uterine cancer: Cancer that develops in the womb. The most common kind is called endometrial cancer. It starts in the linig of the womb.
definitions.uterine prolapse: Happens when the womb (uterus) falls down and presses on the vaginal area.
definitions.uterus: Womb, or where a baby grows when a woman is pregnant.
definitions.utilize, utilization: To use or make use of something.
definitions.UVA: One of the 2 types of light rays in sunlight. UVA is the kind that can cause early signs of aging on your skin and can also pass through a window.
definitions.UVB: One of the 2 types of light rays in sunlight. UVB is the kind that causes sunburns and does not pass through a window.
definitions.vaccinate: To protect against disease, usually by a shot.
definitions.vaccine: A shot that protects you from certain diseases. Also called immunization.
definitions.Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System: A national safety program that watches for problems with vaccines.
definitions.vagina, vaginal: A tube that runs into the womb.
definitions.vaginitis: When the vagina is swollen, painful, and itchy. It can becaused caused by bacteria, yeasts, or parasites.
definitions.valid: Something that is good for or lasts for a certain amount of time.
definitions.validate: To prove or test that something is true.
definitions.valley fever: A disease caused by a mold that lives in hot, dry places.
definitions.vaping: Using a device to inhale vapor, most often with nicotine in it.
definitions.variable: A factor or changes over time
definitions.variant: Something that is slightly different from something else
definitions.varicella: A disease caused by a bug (the varicella-zoster virus) that is easily spread from person to person. It causes a very itchy rash.
definitions.varicella-zoster virus: The bug (virus) that causes chicken pox.
definitions.varicose veins: Swollen, twisted veins that you can see just under your skin.
definitions.variety: Many different kinds of things or events.
definitions.variola: Smallpox, a disease that has been eliminated in the world.
definitions.vascular diseases: Diseases that affect the vessels that blood flows through: veins, arteries, capilleries. They include blood clots, strokes, and vasculitis.
definitions.vasculitis: When an artery, vein, or capillary gets swollen (inflamed).
definitions.vasectomy: A type of surgery that prevents a man from being able to make a woman pregnant.
definitions.vasodilators: A type of drug that is used to treat chest pain (also called angina) in people whose arteries are hardened and narrow (also called coronary artery disease). They can also be used before activities that may cause chest pain. These drugs relax blood vessels so that the heart does not have to work as hard. There are different names for these drugs, including isosorbidide and nitroglycerin.
definitions.vasovagal syncope: When you "black out" (or lose conciousness) for a short period of time. Also called fainting.
definitions.vector: An insect or other animal that carries disease.
definitions.veins: The vessels that carry blood back to the heart.
definitions.venous sample: A small amount of blood taken from the arm to test for lead.
definitions.verbatim: Something that has been written down or repeated word for word.
definitions.verify: To check or find something out.
definitions.vertigo: When you feel that the you or the room that you are in is spinning.
definitions.very low-density lipoprotein: A "bad" kind of fat in your blood that can lead to disease. Also called VLDL.
definitions.vesicular: Blisters or small bumps on your skin filled with fluid.
definitions.VHDL: A "bad" kind of fat in your blood that can lead to disease. Also called very low-density lipoprotein.
definitions.viable: Something that can live or is possible.
definitions.viral shedding: Coughing and sneezing when you are sick.
definitions.viremia: The presence of viruses in the blood.
definitions.virulent, virulence: Something that is strong or dangerous.
definitions.virus: Germs or "bugs" that grow in your body and can make you sick.
definitions.visualize: To imagine or see picture in our mind.
definitions.vitals, vital signs: Your heart rate, blood pressure, breathing rate, and temperature. These 4 signs show how well your body is working.
definitions.vitamin C: An important vitamin that helps the body grow and repair itself. It is found in many fruits and vegetables.
definitions.vitiligo: Causes white patches on your skin when the cells that give your skin color are destroyed. It can also affect your eyes, mouth, and nose.
definitions.voice disorders: This includes many things, from hoarseness from talking too much or smoking or from growths on your vocal cords (muscles that vibrate to create sound). Also called vocal disorders or voicebox disorders.
definitions.voluminous: Something that is large or bulky.
definitions.voluntary: An action that is your choice.
definitions.vomit: To throw up. Also called emesis.
definitions.Von Willebrand disease: A common bleeding disease that you get through your family. It is caused by not having enough of a substance (von Willibrand factor) that helps a certain blood cell (platelets) clump together.
definitions.vulvar disorders: Includes many diseases, including skin problems, cancer or infections.
definitions.walleye: When both of your eyes do not look in the same direction. Also called strabismus.
definitions.waning immunity: Protection against a disease (like a vaccine) that decreases over time.
definitions.warfarin: A type of blood thinner. It helps prevent clots from forming or getting bigger. Blood clots can cause blockages in arteries or veins, heart attacks or strokes.
definitions.warning sign: A sign or symptom of trouble or concern.
definitions.warts: Growths on your skin caused by an infection with a virus (the humanpapilloma virus, or HPV).
definitions.West Nile virus: A disease that you can get from a mosquito bite that can be very mild or very serious (if it affects your brain).
definitions.whiplash: When the soft tissue of the neck (muscles and ligaments) are stretched. Also called neck sprain or strain.
definitions.whooping cough: A disease that causes you to cough and does not stop. It is very easily spread to other people. Also called pertussis.
definitions.Wilson disease: An disease that you get from your parents (inherited). Your body cannot get rid of extra copper.
definitions.windpipe: The tube that goes from your mouth to your lungs. Also called trachea.
definitions.withhold: To hold back or keep from.
definitions.x-ray: A picture of the inside of your body, using small amounts of radiation.
definitions.xerostomia: When your mouth feels dry for a long time. Also called dry mouth.
definitions.yeast infections: Caused by a germ (a fungus) that can grow quickly, causing you to feel ill, in many parts of your body. Some examples are thrush (in your throat) or vaginal yeast infections in women.
definitions.yellow fever: Caused by a germ (a virus) that live in mosquitoes. It affects many parts of your body. The yellow fever virus is only found in certain parts of Africa and South America.
definitions.Zika virus: A disease caused by a germ (a virus) that is spread by mosquitos.
definitions.zinc: A mineral that is needed in small amounts to help the cells of your body work well.
definitions.zit: A common, informal word for pimples or acne.
definitions.zoonoses, zoonotic: The kind of diseases that people can get from animals, such as Lyme disease (from ticks) or rabies (from many animals, including cats and dogs).
